description:
The best Italian. We had fruiti de mari and the other couple had Mario's special sauce and pasta. 

Caffe Macaroni is as authentic as can be outside of Naples and spending time with Mario and Stephanie were great company with great food. 

A perfect lunch. Impossible to go wrong.
author: Jeffrey D.

description:
Got a pretty bad stomach bug from this place that's lasted a week. While I'm aware it's difficult to pinpoint the origin of a stomach bug, my friend and I both woke up the next day with the same symptoms after we shared the food at Caffe Macaroni (seafood pasta and soup). It was the only place we had eaten together. Looking back, something seemed a bit wrong with the pasta, like it used spices to cover up a bad seafood taste. I have a hunch it was the mussels. The next day both of us woke with lower abdomen cramps and haven't been able to get better for a week now. I've gone to the doctor twice and am now on antibiotics, although it's too soon to tell if it's a virus or bacteria. 

I called the restaurant to let them know and the manager, while very polite and receptive of my information, refused to believe that it could've been their restaurant. He noted that no one else had called to complain, but I don't think that's a valid argument since it's pretty rare for people to call a place for getting food poisoning considering there's nothing the restaurant can really do at that point to make you better. 

So, to leave a more well-rounded review, here are other thoughts:  The place has character, and feels pretty cool with the low ceilings. The staff had that Italian attitude that added to the authenticity. But to be honest, the quality just wasn't there. Had my friend and I not gotten a long-lasting and painful stomach bug--and yes, I'm very positive it's from here--I would've rated them 3 stars. 

I hope this is just a one-time only thing. But if you also got food poisoning or a stomach bug, please contact this restaurant so they can tidy things up. 

Happy dining~
author: Brent C.

description:
We Took my son and his wife to this iconic Italian restaurant on Columbus ave not far from the Transamerica Tower. The group chose to dine upstairs under the low red ceiling where the sound is a bit quieter. 

We had the fresh Italian salad,calamari and the fresh meat plate for a appetizers then on to some incredible pasta Dishes that were outstanding. We ordered three different dishes but I assure you the entire selection would satisfy the most discriminating palette. Of course, there was wine throughout the meal and a light creamy fruit topped dessert that was scrumptious. 
Yes, I recommend this restaurant and think you would enjoy the food, enjoyable excellent service in a location that...other than the usual challenge to find parking in San Francisco...is a great place to dine and wine.
author: Willliam O.

description:
Everything about this place it brilliant. 

It's a tiny little cafe/restaurant with seating inside for maybe 8-10 people? They also have seating outside in front of the cafe for another 8-10 people.

One of the greatest things about going to North Beach in San Francisco is that you get real, authentic Italian food made by Italian immigrants and very much in an authentic manner. The people at Caffe Macaroni were great. Very friendly and with Italian accents that make you feel immediately like you made the right choice on where to dine. I haven't heard the word "prego" that many times since I was in Italt two years ago.

I had the baby squid ragu over spaghetti and my wife had the baked pasta. Both dishes were AMAZING. My dish had so much flavor I was using bread to soak up every last bit of sauce on my plate. By the time I was done, my plate was so clean it looked like there was never any food on it. 

Great food, good prices and a very cool experience. Not quite like being back in Italy, but at least very reminiscent.
author: James A.

description:
Tiny little spot with barely 5 tables inside and a few table outside. Makes you wonder how big the kitchen is. Reminds you of Europe...

Started things off with bread with garlic olive oil. The gnocchi chicken with gorgonzola sauce was excellent. They were out of tiramisu...sad face. The cannoli I got instead was good.
author: Sunil R.

description:
I have so many mixed emotions about this place.  I can see why it has great ratings but I can also see why it has some terrible ones.  

We walked up on a Saturday night with no reservations at about 930pm.  There were only 2 other tables taken.  The dining room itself is literally the cutest thing.  It is tiny and cute and transports you to a whimsical place.  Mario (the owner?) was standing outside to greet us but it seemed like he was upset we were coming in.  I sat at the wrong seat and he yelled at me.  

We were trying to order and he would come to our table but not look at us.  He would ask if we were ready but then he would walk away without listening to us.  It felt very much like he was mad and didn't want us to be there.

We never got waters, even though we asked for them and had to ask for the bread.  The bread was terrible!  Seemed older and was stone cold.  The garlic oil was the saving grace.  That oil was freaking delicious.

We ordered the papparedelle and the linguini.  Both were good but not stellar.  There seemed to be missing some seasoning.  Maybe salt.  They just didn't have any oomph.  Not great but not bad.  

The servers were basically ignoring us even if we had a request.  Can I please just have some water?  I wish I spoke Italian so I could know if they were talking about us.  

We wanted to get dessert but they turned the lights off to the display case while we were sitting next to it.  Just rude.

I wanted to like this place but it just didn't happen.
author: Christina R.

description: A very unique and authentic experience. This place is tiny only seats 11 inside and 4 outside. The service is excellent and so is the food. We had caprese with the most flavorful olive oil. I had a halibut special over pasta with a light but very flavorful tomato sauce, fish and pasta were cooked perfectly. My son had the ravioli and loved it. Lemon cake for dessert was also delic
author: Kim H.

description: The Welcoming Atmosphere here is fantastic. The food is good. I would of given this place a higher rating but our waiter kept pushing for us to order more than water. We just wanted water. He asked us 3 times if we wanted Wine. We said no. He then asked if we wanted coffee with our dessert because coffee goes great with Panna Cotta.
author: Jorge P.

description:
Since discovering Caffe Macaroni, I've been coming here almost every month with my coworkers for lunch! It's a small, intimate and authentic Italian restaurant. We love the ambiance. 

Me and my coworkers love the linguine here! It's simple, yet perfect! The mussels are extremely fresh and you can't go wrong with ordering this dish. I've tried the baby octopus special and I thought it was too salty. They give you complementary bread with their garlic sauce.. and it's freakin bomb & their tiramisu is homemade and the best I've ever had -- it's a MUST order!
author: Leilani Y.

description:
This is a really small italian restaurant in North Beach/Chinatown area. While it looks small from the outside with about 4 small tables in the front where the kitchen is, I believe there's a back room that hosts more tables. I have yet to see that because they sat us in the front.

I had the tortellini with pancetta and peas in a creamy sauce. This was my pick the day before a 15K race so I was carbo loading! 

The tortellini was delicious! Filled with cheese and beautifully al dente and dressed in a not so overwhelming or heavy cream sauce. The pancetta and peas were a perfect addition, adding additional creaminess and sweetness to this dish. 

They also start you off with a bread basket and a plate of olive oil with garlic solids inside.

What caught my attention the most aside from the garlic themed decor is the owner in white. Judging by these reviews his name is Mario. There was a pup and his owner stopping by and Mario did not hesitate to welcome the pup by offering him a biscuit. It was so sweet. I love establishments that are pet friendly and cater to man's furry best friend too. 

This place was great and you can tell locals frequent this place, as the patron they sat next to me knew Mario and asked him about his kitchen remodeling.

Will come back to try their other menu offerings!
author: Connie M.

description:
This is a definite occasion in which Yelp had half stars. Three seems too little for the experience but 4 seems a bit high. This is a sold 3.5 in my book.

We were going to the speakeasy for the night so I looked for a reservation within walking distance with great reviews. According to Yelp this is a 4.5 so we were excited. We had a reservation and when we showed up we were surprised to see only seating for 10 people which were all taken. They told us it would be a few minutes. After freezing outside for a while and wondering how we were going to fit they brought us upstairs which we didn't know existed.

The ceilings are low and the place is more than intimate. My wife thought it was a bit too claustrophobic for her tastes and would probably never go back.  

I saw the garlic oil and bread on Yelp and was excited to try it before our meal but ours never came. We asked the waiter for some and it ended up coming after our main course arrived. The service was overall slow and not super friendly (not bad, just not great). This theme seemed to carry over into the night.  The food was all good, but not great. 

We had the:
Pappardelle with ragu which was decent but the sauce was a little thin for me. It also seemed to be missing something (maybe a pinch of salt.)

Ravioli was also good but nothing special. It was a red sauce with a drizzle of pesto on top. The red sauce also seemed a bit thin but it seems that this is what the place is going for.

Chicken/gnocchi dish was just ok. My wife liked it but I thought the texture was off and the sauce was no where near the best I have had. I have tried several gnocchi dishes and this is one I would not go back for.

All of the reviews previously were raving so maybe we had experienced an off night but since there are so many more places to try I would not come back to this one.
author: Danielle B.

description:
Best seafood linguine I've had for a long time! Black squid ink linguine to be precise. The seafood was delicious with huge mussels and clams. The garlic and chilli sauce it was sautéed in was crazy good and I could have eaten another one! 
The place is really quirky and small but that adds to its charm. The waiters were Italian which added to the authenticity of the place and the service was warm and friendly just like I was at an Italian family home!
author: Rachel S.

description: Great fun place for Italian food. Waiter was very outgoing and interesting. You can tell them to serve whatever and they will pick for you. Always quite reasonable and delicious! Good place!
author: Anya C.

description:
Mario and his team were friendly, helpful and fun! Don't miss Caffe Macaroni, when you visit San Francisco. The food is like I remember growing up in Brooklyn, NY.  Don't miss the authentic Calamari! Have fun  and try to get seated upstairs! 

We had great time!  

Vince, Cheryl C. and Angela V
author: Vincent C.

description:
I remember when Caffe Macaroni was the new kid on the block, back in the 90's, & it was the favorite neighborhood place for Italian, for North Beachers.  That is impressive in of itself; North Beachers are notoriously picky & not at all fond of most of the local tourist traps.  

This restaurant might look like a tourist trap by all outward appearances, but believe me it is not.  Authentic, fresh, & thoroughly delicious, CM does pastas & sauces to perfection.  The sauces here, red, white, or green, are all superb.  Salivation worthy.  And the arrabbiata is bomb AF.

The space is funky, tiny, warm, & fun.  Casual is the vibe, so if you're after a refined, elegant dinner, this is obviously not a natural choice.  But, there's Acquerello (on Sacramento Street) for that.  

If you blink, you could miss it.  It is a total gem that is off the beaten path from the usual suspects down Columbus Avenue.  Sit upstairs!  SIT UPSTAIRS!  The ceiling is so low you might hit your head, it feels clandestine & just overall cool.  Like, this is where the Corleone family would have a family meeting...loaded w A TON of fabulous, traditional food.  Service is warm & gregarious.  All they want is for you to have great food & a great time.

Still the neighborhood gem of North Beach.

5 stars
author: Veronica M.

description:
This teeny tiny little place is tucked in impossibly along a stretch of so many little places that it could be easily overlooked.  Well, except that ginormous sign that's hanging out front, and just about as big as the entire inside if you laid it on its side!

When you walk in, the staff is very hot or cold to you, depending on who is there and how well they know you.  They can shower you with samples and delicious treats, or just try to shuffle you through.  Sometimes the unknowns also get love, but not on the same level.

The menu is a bit limited, depending on what you're looking for, but if you ask, occasionally there are other items available (like random lasagna).  The price is reasonable for the amount of food you get, and you might as well throw in a bottle of wine.  Definitely better than some of the other local Italian eateries.
author: Jes G.

description: Wow!!! Absolutely wonderful and amazing!!! We have never felt so welcome and full! The food is delicious and the atmosphere is perfect! Mario & his wife are welcoming. I can't wait till I visit again! Thank you for a very memorable dinner and experience. Highly recommend visiting.
author: Tracy F.

description:
2nd time at Macaroni and it was even better than the first experience.

Came here a week ago for my parents 35th anniversary. This time we sat at the downstairs section (I had previously booked a table) and Chef Mario was nice to converse in Italian with my dad, explain us the specials (You have to ask for it) and served us amazing pasta.

My dad loves simple italian food that has a good homemade tomato sauce and he said the pasta was just like in Italy!!!

Between the four of us we had:

- Spaghetti baby octopus (from the specials)
- squid ink linguini seafood (from the specials)
- pappardelle bolognese ((from the specials)
- spaghetti pizzaiola (from regular menu)
- limoncello cake (MUST ORDER) and tiramisu

All our pastas were just amazing. Fell in love with the baby octopus and got cravings now!!! Figured their best dishes are in the special menu but you have to ask what's in the special menu as the waiter won't bring it up ;) Their specials items are priced 25$ and up but oh so worth it!

Their desserts are too good. In love with the limoncello cake, tiramisu and pannacotta (which we tried last time) so don't pass on dessert.

This place has become my favorite italian joint in town and looking forward to introduce this gem to our friends as well.

Viva Macaroni!!! A Presto!
author: Heliana M.

description:
A tiny Italian restaurant in the downtown business district.  Indoor seating accommodates about 10-15 people.

The Italian entrées were delicious, savory, and well-served.
author: John Richard D.

description:
You'll come to this restaurant for its ambiance and old-world feel, romanticize what life would be like living in Italy for a bit, but then you'll leave for one of the hundreds of other Italian places along Columbus so you can have a decently priced, filling meal. 

We came in around 9:30pm on a Friday and although we didn't have a reservation we were seated upstairs fairly quickly. The servers were all very friendly but the service itself was slow and not very attentive. We never got water and that's the first thing we asked for after being seated. 

We were doing a little "tour of Italy" in North Beach so we came here to share an entree - we had already had apps elsewhere. We ordered the linguine "di mare" but I'd hardly say the amount and variety of seafood present in the dish qualify it as such. We got a handful of mussels and clams, a couple of which were not opened, which means the chef should have tossed them but instead we just got two less pieces of seafood. The white wine sauce was pretty flavorful but it was too liquidy; it didn't have enough butter to really stick to the pasta. The pasta was al dente and that's about the best I can say for the dish. For $19, I'm pretty sure we wouldn't have been full if we didn't have appetizers before (and we ended up getting tapas after)

Overall, this place has charm and personality but leaves much to be desired...
author: Rachel A.

description:
Love their ravioli and pasta
 Really delicious and it feels relaxing. They are nice with people and they also have wine
author: Anny Z.

description: My girls and I had a delicious and enjoyable lunch here. Mama and papa macaroni were gracious and entertaining throughout the meal. We had a warm calamari and bean salad, raviolis, pancetta pasta, ricotta cake and cannolis. We enjoyed every bite!  We even asked for bread to do the sinful wiping of all of the sauce before our plates were cleared.
author: Lisa C.

description: This place is legit af. Their food was amazing, service was phenomenal, and their cannoli made me want to cry because of how good it was.
author: Kody T.

description:
Came here on a whimsical Friday night to give Italian a try in the neighborhood of North Beach. It's rare for me to eat around the area , but hey let's try some authentic Italian food. 

The cafe looks really small when you look outside the glass window, but inside there's stairs to go up with a really low ceiling. 

We made reservations and got seated after 5 minutes. Staff is really friendly and outgoing like speaking Italian-English to their customer. We got seated and waited for 10 minutes for the sever to notice us and order our food. I looked on Yelp to see the popular items and I saw black squid linguine pasta seems to be popular. I ordered it and waited 20 minutes for the food to arrived. Even the other customers who came later than us got their food already... When the food arrived, the portion is so small for the price we paid for- it cost $25 for both of our plates. 

Service is slow, but if you want pricey authentic good pasta this is the place to go.
author: Judy M.

description: Cozy Italian. Good food. suggest the pasta. Friendly service. Good for locals or tourists.
author: Vicki L.

description:
You guys! I love this place. We had walked past a number of times and said we should stop in but when we eventually did, we loved it and have been averaging a visit once or twice a week ever since. We now know Mario and Stephanie by name, who always welcome us with a warm hug. Mario knows what we want to drink and always runs the specials off to us. There is a menu but we usually go with one of the fresh fish dishes that change based on what they have in the kitchen.

It's rare to go to a place where you are made to feel like family. Now anytime we have visitors we take them to "Mario's", our affectionate name for the place. Sure, sometimes you have to wait a little for a table, maybe the service is a little slow on a busier night but it's a small place with a small staff - the food is always served quickly, hot and delicious. The desserts are UH-MAY-ZING! Tiramisu is a must have, my husband rarely eats dessert but he orders that EVERY TIME we come here. If Stephanie's cheesecake is available, order it. I've only seen it twice but both times it's been to die for.
author: Sarah S.

description: Ok so. I ordered the chicken scal with gnocchi and it was incredible. I love and have sample a lot of Italian, authentic and otherwise. The balance of creaminess with lemon was perfect. They put this great purple cabbage on top that I initially thought was a mistake until I tried it - added to the dish perfectly. Its very small and charming inside so don't come with more than 3 people, but come for an evening split a bottle of wine and enjoy! Everything looks good!
author: Amanda P.

description: This restaurant is a hidden gem! Pasta is a good as any Italian restaurant I've had in San Francisco. Would have given it a 5 but the seating is very limited
author: Jeff T.

description: I love the atmosphere of this place. It's my fave Italian restaurant in the city. I always get a bottle of their reasonably priced Chianti (under $30) and it's delicious... we always get the gnocchi and the seafood pasta, and cannoli and tiramisu for dessert.  It's reasonable priced and delish. The service is always great and wait time is low. I take out of town guests here all the time for the most authentic of experiences in North Beach! This restaurant makes me feel like I'm part of their family!
author: Prianka R.

description: Friendly owner.  The food was good, but felt a little expensive for the amount of food.  Great flavors in the sausage with peppers and also the squid ink seafood pasta.
author: Michael F.

description:
I love, love, love, love Caffe Macaroni. Go here. Bring your friends. You'll love it!

Mario (the owner, server, chef, fish orderer) is such a nice guy... always welcoming every time I come. His wife is great... Mikel is great... the hospitality reminds me of being in Italy. Unlike a lot of San Francisco spots, everyone is so genuine.

Food is great. Don't look at the menu, wait for the specials. The fish is amazing. If you're looking for pasta, they do have it, but go with one of the specials (if you're set on pasta the pappardelle is great). This isn't Olive Garden, so there's a lot more Italian food beyond pasta! :)

Atmosphere is great... small and cozy. There's also outdoor seating, but no heaters, so make sure it's a warm day if you want to sit outside.

If you haven't been, go here. I've been so many times in the past 6 months, and is on my rotation of places to bring visitors from out of town!
author: Derrick S.

description: We really enjoyed our dinner here.  Friendly staff, delicious food, plates were completely cleaned.  We made a reservation for 4 at the last minute and they sat us very quickly.  Wish I would have saved room for desert- they looked very tempting!
author: Casey R.

description:
We came here for a birthday lunch. We were seated upstairs - which is funky - kinda low ceiling and a rickety stairway.

It took a little while to get ice water.  But our waitress took our order and answered our questions.  I ordered the gnocchi, with gorgonzola sauce and chicken.  It was tasty - if one note. and the portion was decent- I wasn't stuffed.

Glad I went there for lunch, it felt like I was a tourist in my own city - on a weekday no less!

They did bring a free birthday dessert - which was almost jello (really watery jello cubes with fruit maybe?) and some cool whip, and candle.

They were only willing to split the credit card 2 ways - which I get - would have loved if they had done it 4 ways.

I won't likely be back - but happy I scratched the itch
author: Amy W.

description: Go here now! What a fabulous place. I was in town for work and this place was nearby my hotel so I gave it a shot. Since I was on East Coast time, I was knocking on their door right at 5 PM. They were not ready yet so I had to wait about 15 minutes for them to open but it was so worth it! I had the calamari to start and it was very well prepared - light and flavorful. Then I had the pork special with onions and it was so delicious. Loved every bite of this whole meal. Would definitely come back in a heartbeat
author: Jennifer H.

description: One of the best meals I've had in a very long time. This is a very small restaurant that has charm and authenticity galore. The owner is very attentive to guests and the service is spot on. I had a special dish that featured heavenly pasta with grilled anchovies on top. Heavenly!
author: Tony S.

description:
This place is AMAZING.  Picked it based on the Yelp reviews and it did not disappoint. It is a tiny place. 4 tables downstairs that seat only 12 people and tables on a second floor.  

Wine list was decent. And prices very good both on food and wine. The garlic dipping sauce they bring with bread is like crack. It is delicious. We started with the baby calamari. So good and so tender. The Cheif knows what he is doing. I had the halibut puttanesca special. It was so good. I really enjoyed this dish. We had tiramisu for desert and it was lovely. They even brought us a small shot of limoncello to enjoy. 

I will definitely come back to eat the next time I'm in town. This has been the best meal I have had in a restaurant in a long time.
author: Julie M.

description: The wife and I stopped here for dessert. The espresso was excellent and the cannoli and tiramisu was the best we have ever had. This is a must stop when in Little Italy.
author: Jeremy B.

description:
This is an update to my previous positive review on the food quality. I'm updating it because of the shocking behavior of the owner. I encourage you to keep reading till the end.

Last night, I took my friend there because of my first positive experience. It's a small place so the moment I entered to write down our names, the server who was on her way out told me "you shouldn't stand on the way!" And aggressively pushed me out. I smiled and said I needed a table for two. She ignored me and kept serving others. At first, I thought she just had a bad day but then realized she was actually very nice and friendly to other customers, taking photos of them and trying to be humorous.

We waited for a few more minutes, but she still ignored us and didn't take a minute to write our names down. I was very surprised by this unwelcoming behavior and wanted to talk to the manager but I was told that the server was actually the owner. We left  the place in shock and dined at another restaurant where we were very welcomed.

I don't want to put a label on what she did but it's Trump's America and it gives confidence to people with racist inclinations to expose their beliefs in action. Or even if she was not racist and did this because she hated my appearance for a personal reason, it shows she as the owner doesn't  really value her customers and it's all about money. The restaurant is doing well and who cares if a random customer is humiliated.

When I pick a restaurant my criteria won't be focused on food only. I care about other factors such as how much they really care about us as customers/humans. I wouldn't give business to someone with this kind of mindset. I suggest you not to do so either and dine at a lot of other nice restaurants in little Italy instead.
author: Mariam R.

description: I was in on a weekday lunch with my coworkers. There was no wait, so that was good. Though the space was quite small, they crammed us in the corner. There was no one else dinning at the time,  there which made it uncomfortable to dine and sit. Apparently they have a special menu that's no where to be found. We did order 2 dishes from there. The prices are steep for some pasta. They come out in a big plate but portion size was very small. Hopefully you won't be leaving hungry as we did.
author: Stephanie Y.

description: Meh. I've experienced a lot better, even at home. I ordered the meatball pasta which was so watery that I felt like dipping pasta in a watered-down tomato soup. The meatball itself was at best edible, on par with Subway meatballs. The transparent fridge at the bar contains seemingly old/stale materials which I hope are not being used for food. Adding a star as the owner and the lady seemed friendly.
author: Mike L.

description: Cozy little space with delicious Italian food. Prices are also very fair for some tasty eating.
author: Elise M.

description: Holy cow is this place good! We were in town for a conference and our hotel host recommended caffe macaroni as a good Italian place within walking distance. He was right! We ordered the baked pasta, ravioli and a spaghetti and all were divine! The baked pasta and ravioli - order them next time you go! You won't regret it
author: Kelly H.

description: Real Italian food and real Italian ppl. Authentic and refreshing. Amazing pizza and pasta. The atmosphere was amazingly welcoming and kind definitely recommend to a friend. Best tasting Italian food I have ever tried can't wait to come back.
author: Lillian C.

description: Always make it here when we visit SF.  Food and ambience can't be beat. Has been amazing since the first time we came   almost 20 years ago.
author: L P.

description: Macaroni is arguably the best authentic, Italian restaurant in North Beach! The service is impeccable, the food is divine and the wine selection is extraordinary. As the old adage goes, 'Pictures speak louder than words', so I've included some of the delicious dishes that we devoured! In addition to the phenomenal food and service, try to get a ground floor window seat because the people watching is incredible on a weekend night! Enjoy! Closed sundays
author: William H.

description: Transport yourself to Italy in this original  cafe! Mario the owner overseas his operation & assures you of a authentic experience!  You can have a variety of Italian dishes.  We both had & devoured delicious pasta &  seafood.  The salad & calamari were on point. Tiramisu was inhaled. Stop by for dessert  & espresso-simply amazing! It's a BYOB too!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Pre-marathon pasta dinner. This was the closest Italian restaurant from my hotel with high rating. Made reservations on open table 30 mins before just to make sure we have table.

Arriving around 5:45pm, restaurant was about a half full, mostly looked like marathon runners. By the time we were ready to leave, they were packed with some people waiting for tables. Easy to make reservations online via open table.

Some outdoor patio seats and small dining area on the first floor. Taking narrow steep stairs will lead to low ceiling dining area with more tables. They packed tables so tight, once seated, hard to move around.

Spaghetti with tomato and garlic I ordered was just so perfect. Perfect al dente, just the way I like it. Sauce had nice garlicky flavor, really enjoyed my food. 

It was just happened to be my bambino's birthday, and they helped us celebrate with tiramisu.  I went downstairs to order a tiramisu and asked them if they could put a candle. Servers and all other guests sang birthday song, made the day so special. I had a bite of tiramisu and oh I wished I could have a whole cake or two to myself! 

Although I didn't drink but they had nice Italian wine on their list along with some Italian after dinner liquors. 

Next time when I am in town (not for marathon but just regular business trip), I would love to come back to try different food with a glass of wine or two.

Servers spoke Italian. (S as in plural, both spoke Italian).  I got to practice ordering my food with just a little I know.

Who said we should eat pasta the night before marathon? Don't know but sure glad they were here to serve really authentic dish.
author: Yuko H.

description: Just ok! Food was nothing exciting. We had prawns. Good service. The place is a little shabby.
author: Maura M.

description: What an amazing unexpected surprise!  This place looks like any other Italian tourist trap on Columbus but don't be fooled - turns out it's incredible!  They presented us with menus but we ordered six off menus specials, all of which were mind-blowing good.  Our waitress may have been the kindest, most helpful person we've ever interacted with.  The wine was incredible.  Can't wait to come back again soon!!!
author: Brian D.

description: We dropped in early dinner time, around 5pm on a Saturday. We were immediately seat inside. This place is cozy & comforting. Our food was delish & flavorful. Service was friendly & efficient. Overall a great experience. Wouldn't recommend for groups of 5 or more
author: Aly E.

description:
As you walk up and down Columbus Ave in North Beach, you pass by dozens of Italian restaurants. It's tough to distinguish from a quick glance which are authentically good and which are impostors. Caffe Macaroni, thankfully, is one of the good ones.

We came here for dinner on a Wednesday night with a reservation through OpenTable. The restaurant is quite small inside, with only space for four tables. It's a cozy, intimate atmosphere.

We ordered the steak and penne amatrice. Both came out exactly as we expected, cooked perfectly. There was complimentary bread and olive oil (super garlicky) and we finished with tiramisu for dessert. The food was great, the service was so-so. Fairly sure our waiter was drunk, but he was super Italian and having a good time, so hard to blame him.

A nice spot for authentic Italian in North Beach, but there are so many other Italian restaurants in the area that I'll need to make the rounds before returning.
author: Tim X.

description:
A very small place with great food and service.
We had a party of 7 that were all served on time. Beer and wine were available and seafood was excellent.
author: Chuck H.

description:
I'm always a fan.

There's seating downstairs for a few table (it's small), more tables upstairs (but the ceiling is low and ventilation isn't that great so if someone orders an aromatic dish the whole upstairs smells like it), and maybe 5-6 tables on the sidewalk. Don't be scared away it's great friendly service even if it feels a little cramped sometimes.

My favorite thing is to order spaghetti arrabiatta.  It's technically not on the menu but they make it really well anyway.  And I like to add the garlic from the garlic and bread dip on top.  Some times they go way too spicy but it's still good. I order it every single time and will keep going back for it.

Everything else is tasty too.  I don't think they make their own fresh noodles but the flavors of the sauces are so great.  The papardalle with ragu is great too.  Other favorites: black pasta and seafood, baby octopus pasta, clams and linguine, burratta appetizer and the list goes on.

Dessert: who knew it's great here - the panna cotta is great (just I don't care for the cherry sauce) and the fruits and zabaoine (?) are really good too.

It's $17-$22 an entree so it isn't cheap but where in North Beach are you going to get this quality of food for cheap anyway.

Reservations on OpenTable but sometimes I think they just ignore it completely and do whatever they want.

1 bathroom downstairs in the corner.

Street parking only.
author: Traci H.

description:
WOW, you could walk by and miss this place and you would be SORRY!
Its tiny. 2 tables outside and seats about 12 inside. Every dish is FRESH and homemade. Spaghetti and meatballs were so good! The sauce, is finger licking good (this is what happened when my kids ran out of bread) Gnocchi was fluffy and so filling. So glad we walked here and walked back to the hotel.
So delish! Great customer service and super friendly! 
Don't forget the cannoli's to end your meal!
author: TT H.

description: Not that Cafe Macaroni needs any more five star reviews, this is my favorite Italian restaurant in the city. The place is very small, triangular hidden gem with peculiar Baroque style decoration. Every friend I have brought here has said this is now their favorite Italian place. I ordered Spaghetti De Mare; jumbo shrimp, clams, mussels spaghetti with olive oil, garlic, and red pepper chilli flakes. You must try it! The chef and the servers are all Italians. The chef comes by, explains the specials, checks in wether you are enjoying the food. The servers have great recommendations for wine pairing.
author: Lisa O.

description:
WOW!!! We had the best experience here! We sat at  a table upstairs- my boyfriend is 6'2 and couldn't stand up all the way- very quaint/hole-in the wall- red walls- Italian joint. Our server was Manuel (I think was his name) was outstanding!!! 

We had so much fun at this place! 

The bread came out with crushed up roasted garlic and oil- I swear I could have drank this stuff. 
We got the calamari and a salad to start. The calamari was not fried and very traditionally prepared. Yum! 
For entrees we got the ravioli and a pizza with tomatoes, cheese, basil, and prosciutto.  The ravioli was very good and my friends lived the pizza. The pizza for me did not have sauce on it and the dough was a bit more dense than I prefer. Our server brought out a few bottles of wine per our request and have us many complimentary limoncello shots!! He made our experience so fun! He was from Rome and just loved his job. You could feel his passion and warmth for what he was doing and his customers. 
We had such a fun time and will definitely be back next time we are in San Fran! If you want a FUN, down to earth, Italian dining experience with great service and food- come here!!!
author: Stefanie D.

description:
I have been super excited for weeks to come back to this restaurant and enjoy my nice solo meal on a relaxing day. I intentionally avoided the lunch hour rush. So I got in around 2pm today and it was almost empty.

Wanted to go upstairs to relax and enjoy my late lunch instead of sitting downstairs being stared at while eating.
The guy (owner?) seemed to have an attitude the moment i walked in and didn't allow me to go upstairs. So I got seated downstairs and he threw the menu to my table.

I don't understand people do things like this. What did I do wrong?
I didn't feel welcomed at all so didn't even bother to order. 
I left.

I remember he and his wife were very (or maybe overly) friendly to me and my brother a few months ago but I saw a totally different attitude from the same person today. Why? because I was by myself today? cause I'm Asian in an Italian restaurant?

I feel dumb now to give recommendations to my friends about this restaurant. I was very excited to find another great Italian place but I won't come back.

I really want to understand what I did wrong today.
author: Mac K.

description: Cancelled my reservation four days before it was planned, months ago, for my family guests arriving from NY. Was told it's because they now want to close for the long weekend. When I called. The cancellation was dumped by automated email. I've got a two word review for you, macaronihead, straight from a real Little Italy.
author: jsn R.

description:
This is probably the best Italian restaurant I've ever been to. The ambiance is quaint and romantic, perfect for a date. They've got great Chardonnay. It's small and personable. You'll feel like you're in little Italy for the time being. I loved my server, mainly because she kept calling me Bella, but she was very sweet & a good server. 
They bring out bread and garlic in oil out for you to munch on. I had the calamari as an appetizer & it was wonderful. It's sautéed with a bit of greens. I highly recommend the salmone de gallatto? Not sure if I spelt the last word right. ANYWAYS, if you love salmon like I do, that's the perfect dish! The fish melts & it's buttery, the right amount of salt & the caramelized onions are just yummy! I really enjoyed the clams along with the salmon, potatoes and onions. The sauce left over goes well with the bread if you haven't eaten it all. If you've never had squid ink pasta, that's a must try. 
Everything was just really tasty and perfect. The perfect lunch date with a partner or just yourself!
author: Bao L.

description: This place is quaint, authentic, delicious, and just everything anyone would need out of an Italian date night! We highly recommend and I will never forget this experience!
author: Heather L.

description:
Let me preface by saying that Caffe Macaroni is my favorite restaurant in the city and whenever I go there I feel like I'm with family in Italy :). I don't get such a warm fuzzy feeling elsewhere. It's a neighborhood gem!

The restaurant has a perfectly quaint and warm ambiance suitable for catching up with friends, bringing your parents, or for date night. The seating area on the ground floor has no more than 4-5 tables. Going upstairs you'll find a few more tables in that same warm environment with a window so you can look out onto North Beach.

The service - I can't speak about it without mentioning the incredible waiters/waitresses! Mario is the owner and hopefully you will be served by Mikhael or Angela. Mikhael feels like family to me and interacting with him literally puts me right in Italy! He's quick to bring you some of their bread with the incredible garlic oil for dipping, speedy to fill up that glass of wine, and overall attentive to his guests. They really do treat their guests like royalty. 

The food is DELIGHTFUL and authentic. Pasta is cooking perfectly al dente and you can truly taste the freshness in each of their sauces. My absolute faves are the Penne Amatrice (delectable tomato sauce with pancetta) and the Aglio Oilio (never had an Aglio Olio done as well as here). I stick to these two classics and occasional venture to their specials to have the seafood pasta. But those two top all!

You must have wine here. It is affordable and the best thing to do is to just tell Mikhael to choose one for you. "Mikhael, surprise me" "Okay Bella!"

Love love love this spot!! Happy familial vibes :)
author: Sabina S.

description:
My colleagues have gotten each other addicted to Caffe Macaroni and now I understand why. I'm totally hooked and plan on bringing my boyfriend on a date here someday! The restaurant does not look like much from the outside. Just some patio seating and a few booths inside by the window. There is a more spacious (though tightly packed like in Italy) seating area upstairs, where your head may or may not touch the ceiling. Very cozy feeling.

Our waiter was hilarious and made us feel at home. His name was Michaeli or something like that. Poor guy was waiting on all the tables that evening but always made sure we had what we needed. We started with some glasses of chianti while snacking on Burrata and Bufala. Would highly recommend the Burrata. Both were tasty starts to the meal though.

Everyone at the table ordered the black linguine with prawns, mussels, clams, calamari, baby octopus, and garlic. Our colleague had talked so highly of this dish that we could not turn down the option. It was INCREDIBLE. Words can't even begin to describe how fresh this dish tasted. The seafood was huge and served in generous portions, and the black linguini was clearly homemade. Definitely coming back to have this again.

And of course, we ended our meal with dessert. Well more like my friend ordered tiramisu and I stole a bite off her plate. Heavenly. Especially with coffee. Overall the experience, food, and service were all 5 stars. 6 stars, if that were possible. Thank you Caffe Macaroni for a lovely evening that was dedicated to celebrating our recent successes at work!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Delicious foods, friendly staffs,  highly recommended. 
The only problem is that the place is very small.
author: Arash M.

description:
My first dinner when I settled in Northbeach district. I just want a plate that they can do also for you if it's not on the menu. Macaroni are my favorite pasta. Their restaurant is called also Macaroni. So I thought that it's matching with my preference. They give me a plate of spaghetti with potatoes cut in round and a sauce not finished. I asked them if they had a problem of delivering macaroni pasta ?! I didn't eat and asked for a box but they didn't want and didn't want me pay for this. I gave them another chance, I ordered a tiramisu. It's not bad, home made I think but a little bit not sweet.
However, I have lost time again, I went to the store, not found macaroni, have taken penne whole wheat and did a big plate and ate front their door. Night came, I have wasted so much time and so much energy because where I lived it's not easy to cook, also for a pasta plate !!! Irresponsible boss of a restaurant;you come for a pleasure because you are far from all and you can't cook as you want and you have a professional did you this ! Shame on him ! Call your restaurant Spaghetti, it's more real.
author: Marie-Claire L.

description:
This place is a hidden gem on Columbus Ave! 
The staff is super friendly and the restaurant looks small from the outside but there is an upstairs area, just be careful of the low ceiling for all you tall people out there. 

The food is absolutely delicious and the pasta is fresh. My favorite dish is the Tortellini Pappone (cheese tortellini in a cream sauce with chopped ham and peas). My husband has had their Pork Belly a couple of times and says it's outstanding. Also, their burrata cheese appetizer is not to be missed. It's coupled with arugula, fresh tomatoes and kosher salt. 

I've taken everyone who comes to visit us here because I can't get enough! It's so good!
author: Elizabeth H.

description: I've been here a few times and always enjoyed it. The place itself is very small, so it can be hard to get a seat. They do have a few tables outside though, but in a place like SF, it gets rained out often. It's open fairly late, which is nice, and feels like an authentic Italian pasta shop. They're very flexible with altering menu items for dietary restrictions, but take a bit long to make the food.
author: Alka M.

description:
This place caught by surprise , I got my favorite Italian dinner : Raviolis plus a glass of wine. Well cooked , super tasty , good portions . I will definitely come back. 
Ahh , and Also I recommend to you sit outside on the sidewalk
author: Martin M.

description: I've passed by this place for years and finally decided to give it a try.  Good decision.  It's a tiny place serving authentic Italian fare.  It's located off the main drag, away from the touristy establishments. The service is very friendly and welcoming.
author: Eric C.

description: Amazing place! Best spaghetti and meatballs ever! Attentive staff, limited seating inside--maybe seats 12? Very nice people that work there. They make you feel like family!
author: Laney G.

description: Delicious Squid black ink linguine - tho want surprises me most is the espresso. I dare say it's one of the best I have had in the city.
author: Anthony N.

description: So good! We stumbled upon this restaurant and were given a table on the window upstairs. Service was great. Dinner was delicious - we ordered the ravioli, spaghetti and meatballs, fish of the day (halibut), margharita pizza and the gnocchi. I really wanted the gnocchi but am not a fan of creamy sauces, so they made the dish with a tomato sauce instead. My only suggestion would be to offer kid sized portions. No need for a kid menu as there are plenty of options on the regular menu, but smaller portions for kids would be great.
author: Kathy E.

description:
It was not a planned dinner by any means. Was passing by the place and got hooked by the the friendliness of the owner. Before we know it, we were sitting in the patio, browsing through the extensive menu.
I settled for Amalfitano, black squid ink seafood pasta. Although I am not a fan of bread dipping prior to the course, I have to say the olive oil dip in Cafe Macaroni was great! And the Amalfitano! Perfecto! The pasta was al dente, the seafood was well cooked. Just the right amount of flavor too, not too empowering but certainly not weak either.
I'll certainly be back.
author: Jenny T.

description: I ordered halibut entree and it has sautéed greens with it which is not washed well as I can feel the sand or muddy crunch for each bites at that point. I asked the server for replacement and he said, "no all of the other dishes have the same thing" and lied it was peppers. I've cooked greens before and I know that they have to be washed thoroughly. After that, he took half my halibut without even asking if I wanted the rest! Other than that, the rest of the pasta and soup was good. However, that doesn't make up for my terrible entree. I would not go there again. My worst experience ever :( liked their tiramisu dessert though!
author: Daisy M.

description:
This place was super cute. The ground floor is super small with only 3-4 tables, but it seems there's an upstairs as well. 

The staff is so friendly! They were super attentive. I didn't get the waiter's name but he had a heavy Italian accent. He was hilarious and spoke in Italian all the time even though we didn't know a word. 

Food: 

Garlic olive oil: The garlic olive oil that comes with the complimentary bread is amazing. I love garlic and it had so many little pieces in it. I wish I could have eaten more bread but I would never finish my food!

Linguini del Mare: I am a sucker for linguine and seafood. The pasta was cooked perfectly al dente. The seafood was fresh and delicious. Super flavorful. The sauce was very oily but nonetheless, it was so good! 

Such a cute little gem!
author: Kelly N.

description:
The food is so so,  I don't understand why they have high score.
And the waitress' service is also not good,  most of time there is no service. Just help to order and deliver the food on your table,  then the waitress dispear, but you have to pay at least 15 percent of bill's tips. 
Will never go to this place again.
author: Hakuna M.

description: Charming hole in the wall with heart and history. Food unfortunately is mediocre. The bread was stale and the seafood pasta special was rubbery. I'd liken it to eating at a Italian spot in little Italy Manhattan for those who know NYC.
author: Gardner E.

description:
My family and I were staying in San Francisco and looking to eat dinner at an Italian restaurant. After doing some research on Yelp for a few minutes, I come across this little gem. This was definitely the best decision I made all trip. Authentic Italian food complete with Italian-speaking cooks and servers. This hole in the wall is easy to pass up because it looks a little run down and sketchy, but usually those turn out to be the best eateries.

FOOD: 5 stars. 
Definitely the best Italian food I've had in awhile. I'm not a fan of extremely fancy food. I prefer the quality and taste of food over presentation. This place hit the spot. I don't remember the name of the dish I had, but it was basically a Baked Ziti. You could tell the sauce was 100% homemade. The pasta was cooked to perfection. It was delicious. My brother had the Margherita pizza while my mom and sister split the cannelloni. The cannelloni was fantastic. My dad had the Branzino (?) with spaghetti. This, in my opinion, was the most delectable  because it had so many layers of flavor. I highly recommend that dish. 

SERVICE: 5 stars.
Great service. The owner and bus boy/server were both very welcoming and made us feel right at home. They made jokes with us the whole time and were fantastic. No complaints at all.

AMBIANCE/LOCATION: 4.5 stars.
I think it could be better. Really tiny but it's places like these that I end up appreciating more because they are more friendly and tend to have great food. I just don't like the location of the restaurant. I think I would have preferred it to be closer to Union Square. 

Overall, I have ZERO complaints about this place. If you are looking for AUTHENTIC and QUALITY Italian food, this is your place! I will definitely be back in the future.
author: Zoe Y.

description:
The short: We came here to carbo load for my gf who was running the sf full marathon the next day.  Food was great. Even though the portions were a little small they were packed with flavor. Service however was lacking but they made up for it later.

Food: 5/5 (Would rate it higher actually but can't go over 100%)
Portions: 3/5
Service: 3/5 (they redeemed themselves a star. Read review for details)
Ambience: 5/5

The long: Thanks to the reservation we were seated immediately,  but only a party of 3 was waiting. We were seated outside along the steet.
We were given our menu and waiter/chef said he'd be back. After 10 mins he finally came back to take our order.  So we ordered off the menu the fasul di calamari (squid with cannolone beans, arugula), she got the  linguine di mare (linguine with seafood) and I got the penne a matrices  (penne with spicy garlic tomato sauce and pancetta). A beer and 2 waters to drink.

A waitress brought out the beer quickly along with bread and an olive oil infused with minced garlic and chili flake.  We figured her hands were full to get the water and she'd be back.  Nope, didn't come back with water.  So 15 minutes pass and the squid appetizer arrives. This time it's the original all waiter and we again ask for water.  Again no luck. 

The squid looked simple, almost boring.  When we tried it we were pleasantly surprised.  The squid itself was very tender and flavorful.  The cannolone beans added body and the arugula as fresh and a little bitter. Great appetizer.

Still no waters at this point.  Getting thirsty, I start drinking the gf's beer.  After another few minutes we get the waiter/chef over again, order another beer and we finally get water.  Now this was probably 30 minutes since we sat down.

Shortly after receiving our water, our pasta comes out, but were missing the other beer which we never received.  Again very simple looking.  Portion was small. Our expectations went down after seeing the dishes.  We take our first bite and smile at each other.  My penne was garlicky, meaty and hearty.  Immediately gave a bite to the gf and she said the same thing.  She gave me a bite of the linguine and the sauce was amazing. Fresh, briny, garlicky goodness.  The clams and mussels were just steamed to the open they opened which meant they were tender.

While eating, the waiter/chef gave the menu to another group. Then he started saying the specials.  I was like "what?!" I wanted to hear the specials also! They had a homemade papardelle pasta with ragu and fresh grated parmesan. Would have ordered that if I knew. Not that I was unhappy with my dish but that was what I craved for last night.  This waiter/chef was killing me.

After finishing our food, the waitress clears our plates.  She asks if we received our second beer.  I said no but it's ok at this point.  It turns out the waiter/chef is her husband and although she was sorry, she loved when this happens so she could rip her husband a new one. Before proceeding to give her husband a new orifice, she wanted to make sure we were not charged for the second beer.  

She came back with the check and apologized about the beer and the wait.  She told us to take our time and went back into the restaurant.  I reviewed the check. 
Pasta amatrice, check. 
Linguine di mare, check. 
Only one beer, check. 
That was it. 3 items.  They had missed the calamari.  Thinking to myself do I want to save money and hide the error, or support this little restaurant,  I opted for the latter. So the waitress comes over and I let her know she didn't charge us for the appetizer.  She was stunned I even mentioned it. She smirked.  I knew immediately her husband was going to get another verbal thrashing.  She appreciated my honesty and said she the appetizer was on her.  Feeling happy about saving money but at the same time a little guilty we left a generous tip.  

As we were getting ready to leave, the husband comes out and apologizes (good job wife!). In his hand is a shot. My gf's face lights up.  They gave us a free shot of limoncello.  The beginning of a good night (you know what I mean), but you're here for the restaurant, not to read about my gf.
author: Daniel H.

description:
3.5 STARS 

Caffe Macaroni is a cute little Italian restaurant at the junction between North Beach, FiDi, and Chinatown. I was uncertain of what to expect, because the signage and decor seemed very old school / divey and reminded me of a mom and pop version of Buca di Beppo. Then, when I arrived I noticed the wait staff varied from stand-offish to boisterous; this place seemed to attract alot of European tourists and return customers. The service was a bit slow, and forgetful, but friendly in an almost obtrusive way. Our server described each dish like this, "Pappardelle bla bla bla" - literally. I don't know what to make of it.

Venue: There are a few small outdoor tables for 2-4 people (no heating lamp), a few indoor tables (4-6 people), and a small upstairs section which could seat a few small parties or one large party of maybe 15. It's a bit claustraphobic, but cute and oddly decorated with neon green twinkle lights and parchment paper rolls, a low ceiling, and a nice street facing view. The upstairs area got really loud and there were only 6 other people there. Reservations were somewhat easy, and I saw several walk in (Tuesday at 7:30PM) without much of a wait.

Food: 
* COMPLIMENTARY BREAD AND GARLIC OLIVE OIL - 3.5 STARS:
Mediocre but fresh bread, soft on the inside but crusty on the outside. Served with their house made garlic olive oil, super flavorful and addictive. I think they use the same bread for the pizza.

* BUFFALO MOZZARELLA E PROSCUITTO  - 2 STARS:
Small and mediocre piece of mozzarella (think: Costco, not bad but not great), served with maybe 4 slices of standard proscuitto. Meh, I've had better.

* SQUID INK LINGUINI ($17) - 4 STARS:
This is not on their menu (note: their online and restaurant menu differ slightly). The seafood was mediocre in quality and freshness, but it was really flavorful and one of the two favorite pastas of the evening.

* PAPPARDELLE BOLOGNESE - Special ($17) - 4 STARS:
This house special was very simple, yet so delicious - the other favorite pasta dish of the evening. The pasta and the sauce were perfectly executed - the pasta was nicely al dente, and the sauce and cheese were unexpectedly delicious. 

* SAUSAGE PASTA ($17) - 3 STARS:
Mix of farfella (bow tie) and rotini pastas served with pasta. It was just not my cup of tea.

* PORK LOIN - 2 STARS:
A bit dry and flavorless, served over cannelloni beans. Skip.
author: Jess C.

description: Ordered Fasul E'Calamari, Prsutt Salam E Murtadell, and Squid ink pasta.  They were all delicious, and we were well entertained while we were eating by restaurant owner (I believe).  Next time I am in this area, I want to drop by.
author: Shin O.

description: Such a hole in the wall, very rustic and be prepared for a staircase and very low ceilings if you eat upstairs. Everything was rickety but the staff were Italian and service was reminiscent of a casual Italian restaurant- lovely and friendly just a bit slow and "relaxed". Didn't mind it because I loved the staff. The food was great- if there's something not on the menu you'd like, ask! They just might be able to accommodate you.
author: Piper W.

description: Very tastey and mostly authentic preparations of Italian and even some Sicilian dishes. Owner is very friendly. Great skyscape view outside on sidewalk patio area. Reasonable prices. Get the pan browned whole sardine over pasta for one if your entrees. Delicious and can't find elsewhere.
author: Len G.

description:
It's just perfect. The atmosphere, the decoration, the feel, the owner, the cooks and of course...the food!

I picked this place after reading some Yelp reviews about restaurants around little Italy.
I got there around 2PM, for a late lunch. There was only one couple seating in this super tiny restaurant (4 tables of 2 outside, 5 tables for 2 inside. There might be an upper floor, I didn't check).

The owner/waiter is Italian. Being from an French-Italian family, I ordered a special dish composed of Mozzarella and antipasti only, the sardine spaghetti, anchovies and a bottle of (excellent) Montepulciano. See photos for details.
I won't describe all the great feelings I had while eating there. Everything was gourmet, well prepared and cooked (al-dente spaghetti). Sardines were amazingly grilled with herb and garlic and my antipasti was seasoned to perfection!
I had a very nice espresso to conclude this amazing meal. 51$ for the whole thing. Unbeatable. Complementary bread and super garlicky olive oil.

Its not a sophisticated cuisine, but the food is just plain good.
I do recommend this place if you feel like having Italian food in San Francisco.
Will definitely go back.
author: Sylvain B.

description:
Cozy little Gem. 

Owner and waitstaff were friendly and personable.  Owner read off like a dozen specials, we had him repeat it several times cause we couldn't remember all of them (even though half were on the menu ).

Started off with a bottle of Pinot Grigio from Italia.  Nicely chilled and crispy.  

Our meal:

Antipasti: anchovies, mozzarella di buffala and squid salad. All good!  

Pasta: black linguine (squid ink) with clams, mussels, calamari and shrimp, risotto pescatore

Special: petrole sole over eggplants sautéed in tomatoes and capers (from my taste but may have other stuff)

Dessert:  tiramisu, panna cotta

Compliments of the owner: Limoncello shots

Portions were on the small side (IMO) but everything was tasty.  Pasta was cooked al dente and the fish moist and tender.

Place is small, seating up to 10 people in the restaurant, a few sidewalk tables outside, there's also upstairs seating but I didn't get to check it out.  From other Yelpers, seats about another 10.  

Cozy little gem.  Oh, I said that already. :)
author: The Q.

description: Café Macarroni smells good and it's hella good, real italian food. We got margarita pizza and raviolis. The service it's not good buuut they had reeggeaton and bachata!  so, se la perdonamos!
author: Balam Q.

description:
One word: disappointed.
My girlfriend and I were craving for Italian food, and we were excited to come as it has great reviews and Italian is our favorite cuisine. We went ahead and made a same day reservation since it was Valentine's day. Fast forward 2 hours, we were received by Mario who was very nice and led us to our table upstairs, up to this point everything was going well until the waitress took about 10mins to give us our menu (I had to ask her about it), and yes she was the one who seated us, so it was strange she forgot to give us our menu. Anyway, she took our order promptly and left. 30 minutes passed by and no water, no bread, we were totally forgotten and mind you this is a tiny place. 

After 1 hour of waiting, the food finally arrives. You'd probably say "well it's Valentine's day of course the food will take longer than usual", this is a small restaurant plus two couples who arrived after us got their food first, in fact, our food arrived when the people who arrived after us already finished! To make matters worse, the food was very disappointing. The pasta was not cooked properly, felt like they rushed in their cooking, and this was for both mine and my gf's dishes. The portions were not generous and they never filled our water. 
In the end, by the time we left this restaurant we were still hungry, thirsty, and not satisfied with the taste. A waste of money and a waste of 80+ minutes of our life. We should have eaten Italian food at home instead, as I cook way better Italian food, faster, and a quarter of the price than this restaurant. We will NEVER come back.
author: Hugo V.

description:
5 star for the food and - 4 star for the service. 
1. Asked water 3 times from the beginning of the dining, but never got it. Apparently, the gentleman right next me received water as soon as he asked server. I am running to some other store to get water now.
2. Only check was arrived on our table on time. We wait for the bread to be served to our table until other customers, who came later than us, received food. 
If you don't care about service, this is great place to visit. Don't expect too much except the food.
author: Davis Y.

description: My husband and I enjoyed a wonderful meal here.  The food was delicious and the service was friendly and attentive. The restaurant is lively.  Only a few tables downstairs and a few more upstairs in a very fun space. This is a small restaurant so be sure to make a reservation. We started with the white anchovies and grilled calamari with white beans.  My husband had pappardelle noodles in a lamb ragu and mushroom sauce while I had the black linguini with seafood and mussels for our mains.  We polished off our meal with a lovely light lemoncello cake.  I loved what I had.  This is a real Italian restaurant.  A big shout out to Mario from Napoli, Claudio from Venice and our handsome young waiter from Florence.  Grazie for a fine evening!
author: Gabriella S.

description: Caffe Macaroni is one of my favorite SF haunts. My husband speaks Italian so he loves to go here and feel back home in Italy. This place is a unique dining  experience that makes you feel like you went to Italy for dinner. The warmth and friendliness of the staff is amazing! You can sit outside on a warm night and enjoy views of the TransAmerica building or you can head up the small narrow staircase and dine in the unique and cozy dining room with low ceilings and windows that open out onto city streets below. I love coming here! I would walk here when I lived in SF. It was always one of my favorite things to do. I can't wait to take my son here for the first time and show him one of my favorite places in San Francisco. Maybe one day my husband and I will get to take his Italian relatives to Caffe Macaroni to share our favorite slice of Italy in the states.
author: Shannon B.

description: This is a great authentic little Italian restaurant and I had a great experience there. I love the Italian ambience they created. Waiters are seemed to be all Italian and they were singing and speaking Italian loudly. The food was great too!
author: N W.

description:
This adorable authentic little Italian restaurant is easily my favorite restaurant in San Francisco. 

The complimentary bread comes with a crushed garlic oil and wow, I could bathe in this. It's the perfect primer for the amazing meal you are about to have.

* Food: 5/5 - The best Italian food I've had in a long time
* Service: 5/5 - Mario will take great care of you and Mikhael is absolutely hilarious. He will make you laugh!
* Ambience: 5/5 - This place is cozy, cute, and a hidden gem. It makes for an adorable date spot! It's equally great for a cozy meal while catching up with a friend. 

What I usually order:

* Penne Amatrice - The pancetta adds great flavor to this delightful tomato pasta dish. The penne is perfectly cooked and the pecorino is a nice touch on top. 
* Spaghetti Aglio Olio - perfectly al dente spaghetti with olive oil, red pepper flakes, and a solid amount of garlic. If you're a garlic lover, this is the dish for you! I get mine with extra parmesan on top.  

Let Mikhael get you a bottle of wine and don't even specify which wine you want. He nails it every time! 

Delicious Italian food, great wine, and outstanding service. These guys make you feel like you are family. I essentially have zero complaints about this place - they're doing everything right! 
.
author: Karina S.

description: I had the linguini di mare and he had the ravioli with spinach and pesto with red sauce. Wonderful! Cute little space, friendly owners. Recommended.
author: Babette G.

description:
Always a treat, had a Killer Porcetta tonight . Always a treat with wonderful recommended wine, and always super service. It's my home away from home! 

Another great meal and Service thank you Mario
author: Ronald S.

description: The dip that comes with the bread is AMAZING! I got the linguine al mare (?) basically linguine with clams and mussels and it was pretty delicious. Wish it had more flavor tho. It's SF so it's pricey.
author: Devika P.

description:
The food, the ambiance, the owner (Mario) and his wonderful team are the real deal. Oh yes, this place is so Italiano! The red vinyl long bench, the bright red stilettos hanging on the wall and the dangling garlic garlands in the front windows will grab you the instant you step foot into this gem of a place located in North Beach. Inside this warm and charming caffe, rest assured the kitchen will whip up some of the best culinary delights imported from Italy. Listen to Dino belt out some Italian favorites to set you in the right mood....

                      "When the moon hits your eye like a big pizza pie
                                                 That's amore
         When the world seems to shine like you're had too much wine
                                                  That's amore"

So could Pavarotti and Bocelli!

Mario quickly showed us to our table and served us a complimentary basket of warm crusty bread with a side of chopped garlic and olive oil as a tasty spread while we browsed the menu. A great way to start as an antipasto was CM's own Pan Pumarol ($6.75). This was a bruschetta-like grilled focaccia bread and came in four oversized slices. The bread was coated with garlic and topped with tomatoes, oregano, olive oil, salt and pepper. Fresh garlic gave the bread a strong, pungent and nutty flavor. The grilling gave the bread the perfect crunch. Delizioso!

Next was another dish which honest to God, I've never had before prepared this way. It was labeled in the menu as Fasul E'Calamari ($13.00). This was fresh Monterey calamari served in a light tasty broth with cannelloni beans, wild arugula and chopped tomato. Compliments to the chef for not overcooking the calamari, as the calamari was soft and tender and so were the cannelloni beans. There was not quite enough liquid to drink as a soup but plenty that begged to be sopped up with focaccia. Highly recommended! 

The best dish tonight was unequivocally the Linguine Neri (Squid Ink) served with an assortment of Shell Fish ($21.75) like clams, mussels, calamari tentacles and a large shell-on shrimp. The full-bodied sauce as far as I can tell was a concoction of white wine, olive oil and garlic. What was interesting was the squid ink, a weird black colored ingredient that made the linguine look black, rich and briny. Contrary to common belief, while the black squid ink did add a subtle seafaring flavor, it was neither too salty nor briny. Instead, it paired well with the shellfish. I can say that if you love cioppino, you would love the flavors of squid ink linguine with shellfish.

Mario, the owner, was the perfect host. He was loud, he was quirky and above all funny. It was quite a welcome change to hear only Italian spoken among his help with Mario (in a nice way) as their Godfather. He hails from Positano, Italy and makes no bones that he appreciates your patronage. Parking can be a challenge and it may be easier later in the evening when the cars are gone from the nearby FiDi.

Grazie tanto!
author: Geoff G.

description:
After reading some reviews in Yelp I thought it would be a great idea to go there with my fiends. 
I made a reservation and we went there for dinner. 
First of all the place was so old and really small; there was no room on the terrace so we had to get on the second floor, in a kind of annex with a very low ceiling and where it smelled pretty bad.
About the service, the waiter was too expressive and he was not very helpful in ordering the food.
The food was correct but did not match the price we paid for it.
We probably thought that as the owner was Italian the products would be of high quality, but unfortunately it was not so.
I really do not recommend this restaurant either for the quality of its food or for the price you pay for it. The facilities and service do not match with what was expected.
author: B R.

description:
My experience with Caffe Macaroni was average. The main factor that impacted my rating towards this restaurant was the food that I ordered. I may have ordered the wrong food to my liking so that MAY be the case.

Anyway, my co-workers and I went here for lunch since this was highly rated. When we walked in, I was surprised at how small the restaurant was. The maximum occupancy inside would probably be 10.

I ordered the spaghetti aglio and it came out in about 10 minutes of ordering. Before that, we were given breadsticks with olive oil with a ton of garlic inside. I wasn't a huge fan of the breadsticks. It was cold and hard... My spaghetti was also bland. Very bland. The blandest spaghetti I've ever had. I love Italian food, but this was probably the worst and it was disappointing.

Would I come back here? I mean, I'd like to give it another shot... Just don't order the spaghetti aglio.
author: Aj C.

description:
This wasn't the kind of Italian place that I'd ever been to. As a matter of fact, I don't think that there was macaroni on the menu. Most of the entrees on the menu that I'd never heard of. 

I found myself here with a group of seven other fellow Community Ambassadors, including Ophelia M. whose review pretty much sums it up. 

I too ordered gnocchi and gorgonzola. The tiny bits of potato goodness leaves me thinking about it weeks later. The portion wasn't huge but it was enough to fill up. I guess I'm a big eater or I was really hungry that night. 

The fact that the waiter wasn't able to separate the ticket was a bit of a disappointment, but not a huge deal though. The waiter was effective and nice, but the place was practically dead, I think there was one other party besides us. 

The red stilettos hanging from the wall... how can I forget to mention those?!
author: Heather P.

description: A few days ago, I was visiting this restaurant with friends. Interior and authentic Italian style are really good, especially music. But if you're hungry and want to eat this restaurant is really bad choice. Secondrate dishes and very expensive. I wouldn't recommended this place to people who values tasty food. Around a lot of other restaurants with more delicious and bigger portions for more less price.
author: Sergii S.

description: My humble opinion is that this is the BEST Italian restaurant in north beach! Everything about our visit here was perfect...the food, the service and atmosphere!
author: Melanie O.

description: Genuine Italian home style goodness!  Our party had the spaghetti with meatballs, and a pizza.  Outstanding would be an understatement of the flavor, atmosphere and the customer service top notch!  Will be in my stable of Go To's in San Francisco
author: Stephen H.

description:
Don't let the atmosphere and odd bedizenment fool you (frayed and scuffed ruby red stilettos hanging on the wall? what?!), this little hole in the wall is serving up some mean Italian eats.  The sort of food that inexplicably reminds you, as you attempt to resist the urge to moan and pound your fist on the table (dining companions be damned), of Italy's rich artistic history.  Michelangelo, Botticelli, Caravaggio...

I mean, I'm not saying that my beautifully thinly carved chicken, delicately seasoned, then placed over a bed of gnocchi swimming in gorgonzola cream sauce was the culinary artistic equivalent of...say...the ceiling of the Sistine chapel or something--of course that would be hyperbole (barely, only ever so slightly, the teensiest bit, really--hyperbolic).

I was dining in a large group (there were 7 of us).  We literally stumbled into this place as we were in search of dinner somewhere that could accommodate our group without reservations.  Caffe Macaroni sat us immediately.  The service was prompt, lovely, and patient (given I ordered one thing, and then upon hearing another diners order which included the words "gnocchi" and "gorgonzola"--the cheese of the gods, my people!--changed my order).  

Side note of silliness?  I could listen to the server with his thick Italian accent talk all night.  He could literally read directly out of Pilgrim's Progress (one of the most boring books ever penned) and I would have been enchanted (I admitted it was silly).

One final note:  If you are in need of separate checks, let them know as you order as once the ticket is run, they were unwilling to rerun it and couldn't (or didn't know how) to run one ticket with multiple cards.  A small thing--but something that is more convenient if you know going in!

Get to it!
author: Ophelia M.

description: Off the menu squid ink linguini is the best!!! And really large portion! Perfected my SF trip!
author: Jany Z.

description: Wow I don't even know where to start. Terrible food. Sloppy service. Over priced. We saw reviews on yelp and thought this place would be great. Really disappointing.
author: Sachin S.

description: Wonderful, quaint and extremely friendly staff! We had a great time and the food was phenomenal. Would highly recommend!! Calamari was out of this world and everyone LOVED their entrees!! Felt like we were in Italy for the 2 hours we were there.
author: Lesley L.

description: This place is top shelf.  Food is fabulous and the people who work there are awesome. You must give it a try.  You will love it.
author: Alice D.

description: I walked in on my random, thanks to the wonderful garlic scent coming from the door. Was soaked in a bath of olive oil, garlic and gnocchi. This is absolutely a must stop if you're in north beach. So good.
author: Bobby H.

description: The food was amazing! Felt very authentic and loved sitting outside. We had the an antipasti and a pasta and it was the perfect amount for 2 people!
author: CarolAnn W.

description: Super charming and authentic, delicious and beautifully served. But so small that it actually makes it tough to move. The garlic oil on the bread is insanely delish.
author: Ken K.

description:
"Magical" is a word I rarely use in writing a review, but when I get that fleeting chance, you can bet I'll use it.  And because I'm using that word, I'll make this review more of a story.

Our story took place this week-- in Nov 2015.  My global #LinkedInLife cohort and I were in SF for new hire training. We were a group from Hong Kong, London, NY, Chicago, and of course Cali. When we were ready for dinner, the one cuisine on which we could all agree was -- Italiano!  (side note-- is food the path to world peace?  Methinks so).  Coincidentally, Emi, our British born, yet Japanese colleague had a Sicilian cab driver on her way in. When she asked for restaurant recommendations, Caffe Macaroni was the first out of his mouth.  When she told us, we all immediately thought Macaroni Grill.  No offense, as MG has saved me many a night in mid America, but CM was/is on a completely different  dimension.

Our impromptu outing began at our conveniently located hotel, Galleria Park, which hosts a lovely happy hour every evening.  Primed with a nice Mondavi Napa valley cab, we all quickly agreed on Italian (Emi and I had walked by the previous night, so we had already scoped it out).  Knowing the storefront looked to be the size of a shoebox, I called nonetheless.  "Excuse me, but do you happen to have a table for 10 available.. for NOW?"  I tried to ask gently (My inner Hungry Hippo starting to take over).  "Of course!  C'mon over"  was the welcome reply. 

After a missed turn from Google Maps (seriously, Google!), we made it to CM.  As I said, it looks to be the size of a shoe box, and the front booth was already filled. Nonetheless, the owner graciously welcomed us.  CM looks as though it's pulled straight out of Europe-- sidewalk cafe tables, long booth facing the front window, and the kitchen front and center. Then and there is where the magic began.  

Like the first note in a symphony, the smells of the kitchen permeated the air.  My cartoon-self started floating towards it.  My practical self, asked, "But where is there room?"
