We then met our server extraordinare, Michele, who guided us through a small opening, up the stairs to the second floor, that had ceilings so low, I literally scraped them (I"m only 5'11).  It is painted all red with various adornments on the wall -- it's the authentic look chain restaurants always go for, but never achieve.  "Gratzi!" I replied-- which kicked off a hilarious opus of Spanglish-Italiano among all of us all night.  Michele served to be not only our waiter, but our entertainer and muse, kindly laughing at all our silliness and adding to the fire with his own retorts.. "prego prego!". 

We ordered an assortment of antipasti-- pizza, charcuterie-- and although I didn't get any pizza (ahem!!!!), it smelled amazing and my colleagues would have said as much if their faces weren't stuffed.  When it came to the main entree-- my Rabbit bolognese with housemade pasta rags-- all the promise of those original smells on sidewalk was delivered wholly and completely. I eat a lot of Italian (my hubby is Sicilian!) and this meal was there at the top.  The pasta was perfectly al dente, and the sauce was delicious, perfectly clinging to the pasta.

Our story concludes with a promise to dear Michele that I would write this review on Yelp.  The morale being-- when you have an experience like this-- the food, the energy, the laughs-- you must pay it forward.
author: Matthew S.

description:
I read reviews on how "magical" this place is, and they're absolutely right. The squid ink pasta came with seafood, I was in love at first smell! 

Yes, it's small. No, you won't dislike anything. Get out of your comfort zone here, explore the menu and wine! It's not expensive either, so eat up!
author: Mariah G.

description: First off, the people who work here are just incredible and are such characters. As soon as you walk in you get the feel of this being a cute little local place when the owner greets you at the door and your waiter is a loud Italian who constantly talks to you in Italian even though you don't understand (we just nodded our heads and laughed haha) we were hugged by our waiters as we walked out and we left feeling so warm because the people here were just so kind. My mom got the ravioli and I got the pesto pasta. We both preferred mine. Oil that comes with the bread was great but I do wish they would warm the bread up before it comes out and the nice waiter gave us a glass of wine on the house which we appreciated. Try to sit upstairs if you can because the ceiling is interestingly low but it creates a super cozy and family like environment. Can't say I would necessarily recommend it if you are solely looking for good food but I personally think it's worth popping in here and splitting a dessert or entree just to experience this place.
author: Cara N.

description: Wasn't overly impressed by the pasta. If anything, the sausage was above average in taste and quality. Wouldn't consider it an amazing Italian restaurant. Moreover, the price is on the expensive side and I was not overly impressed with the food. I wouldn't recommend it to a friend.
author: David S.

description: The best food, the most amazing service/staff and to top it off, you feel like you're in Italy! We are so happy to have came across this gem in the neighborhood! It's perfect!! Thank you Angela and Miguel for providing us such a wonderful dining experience for my Mom on her birthday!!!
author: Mai H.

description:
Pretty delicious here. It's a hidden gem and I had an enjoyable time. Kicked it off with the squid appetizer - 4/5. The salad with the cheese wasn't bad, but I'm not a big fan of cheese - 3.5/5. As for the actual entree, I ordered the pasta with sausage. The portion was a decent size, but if you're hungry, you'll want to order more - 4.5/5. The linguine with the clam/mussels was surprisingly delicious 4/5. The tiramisu wasn't bad for dessert. 

I'd return here again if I were craving italian. The owner/manager was very social, the staff were friendly, and the food was good. Make sure to book a reservation in advance.
author: Albert K.

description: Showed up at 9:45pm after reading they close at 11:00pm. It's tiny, maybe 8 people max can fit in here. So he offers outside table, on December 2nd, in San Francisco.... we said we'd wait for an inside table. Goes in, comes right back outside and says we actually can't help you anymore kitchen closed at 9:30pm.. wtf! Super rude!
author: Lcuellar1991 ..

description: This was my favorite restaurant in San Francisco so far! My group of 8 all ordered the specials, bolognese, pork with potato, ink pasta with mussels and prawns. All we're pretty AMAZING!The owner/ waiter was so friendly and personable!!! Seriously delicious and great Italian from great Italians! Thank you Mikael!!!
author: Soozi Q C.

description:
Amazing cozy spot tucked between the financial district and north beach. It's very small and intimate but you feel welcome and warm here.

The best thing is off menu -- the squid ink pasta with seafood. It's a reasonable size portion with hefty amounts of clams, mussels, squid and prawn.

The arugula salad is also a good size and not price by SF standards.

There was an Italian white wine by the glass that starts with a V that they recommended that was excellent with the seafood.

Great value for the quality and friendly Italian service.
author: Victor W.

description: Came here on a weeknight an hour close to closing. They were really accommodating and nice. There was 4 of us and we ordered: coffee, wine, salad, pasta, risotto, and dessert. Which all were amazing. They let us order dessert even though they were technically closed. It's hard to find good customer service and amazing food in one spot and they most definitely got it down.
author: Kalin W.

description:
Came here several weeks back, with my coworker ordering some simple spaghetti dish with garlic, while I went with one of their daily specials, the tagliatelle carbonara with eggplant.

And, as many a place often does, they served bread as an appetizer. What Caffe Macaroni does differently though is that the olive oil they serve up is chock full of actual slices of garlic, which adds for some great flavor.

The carbonara I ordered was not quite what I expected, thinking it was something more akin to the one you can get at Chez Maman. Still, enjoyable, though I'm admittedly not a huge fan of al dente style noodles.

And, having tried a bite of my coworker's spaghetti, I can say that was quite tasty, despite being so simple. The chili flakes added after were definitely key.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - Another fairly small space, but I'd say about half their seating is accessible, albeit a bit cramped.

Bathroom - Didn't check them out.
author: Johnny W.

description: LoVed it!  Meal was fantastic and so was the staff. Went with my wife, brother-in-law and his wife and we all left saying how much we enjoyed our meal and time there tonight. I highly recommend it!  Great food and great prices. A very personal experience.
author: Chris S.

description: Holy shit is this place good! And I love that their daily specials are written in dialect. Was there today for lunch and was blown away. Transported to a little café in Italy. Started with a gorgeous salad of perfectly ripe orange slices, shaved baby fennel, and radicchio. Then had the best pesto outside of Genoa. Wow! Finally a chef not afraid of salting the pasta water. Perfectly made cannoli and espresso to follow. Can't wait to return and try their sea food specials.
author: Aaron N.

description: If I remember, they opened about 1993 and it wasn't in the busy part of North Beach so...for all these years I went right on by, shame on me. Excellent...so much fun. The food was outstanding, I don't eat a lot, just often, but trust me, my food was just fantastic! The prices were not as high as the restaurants in a more central North Beach area. This location is Columbus St. but across from where Clown Alley used to be. That turned out to be good for a few reasons...you can comfortably dine outside without people stepping on your toes or bumping your table as they pass by. The Transamerica Pyramid is half a block away, it's a nice view, and the Landmark Cinema is about a 8 minute walk. The service was good...one thing, when I order a specific mineral water and I get a different kind, I like to be told they don't have what I ordered. not bring me something else and not say anything. This would normally be a dink of one whole star but the charming "Mario",  the owner made up for that oversight by introducing me to his wife...beautiful and charming! They are wonderful people, food was super good and the price was decent...nothing this good is cheap.
author: Rodney M.

description: I had the best authentic linguine di mare. Staffs are super friendly and so Italian. I made a reservation and got seated after 5 min. Some people may think the service is slow, but it just because they are so friendly and enjoy making a small conversation with their customers. I didn't mind it at all. I would definitely come back again!
author: Yurie S.

description: Visited at lunch time with my parents. Charming decor and nice server. We all had the seafood pasta, which was ok but nothing special. Pasta was well cooked but the seafood didn't taste that fresh and nor did the chili and herbs. Most annoyingly, the owner kept going in and out of the restaurant all through lunch, largely needlessly, which created cold draughts constantly in the restaurant. He was more concerned with hustling more tourists into his restaurant than thinking of the comfort of his current guests, which I find unforgivable.
author: Robin B.

description: Good place to stop by and grab a bite. It might not look appealing at first because it is small in interior and located right next to China Town, which doesn't seem like a prominent location for Italian restaurants, but the food there is very nice. The employees are all Italian and speak the language fluently. Service was great and the waiter was very kind. There's about 10 seats inside and out and the atmosphere, at least to me, was cozy. If you want to go for a big birthday or for a splurge, accompanying more than 3-4 people, I would not recommend this place. It's more of a fair priced, very authentic place to grab a bite. Maybe during your lunch break, or after walking around alot. Portions are not too big, neither too small. If you are starving, you might want to get something else with your order.
author: David M.

description: The food is amazing here. Such great hospitality from the owners. Food is very reasonably priced for the servings. All 3 of us cleaned our plates from appetizers to the deserts and the bottles of wine. Perfect place for memorable rustic Italian food.
author: Diego G.

description:
A hidden gem in Little Italy. Amazing food. On first glance, it looks tiny, but there is a second floor. Cute place, owner is Italian, food is DELICOUS.

Taste:  5/5
Service: 4/5
Atmosphere: 4/5
Value for Money: 4/5
Would I come again: Yes
author: Jackie M.

description:
There aren't that many places like this left in North Beach and it's a shame. I came here for lunch with a friend and we both really liked the food and atmosphere at Caffe Macaroni. There were tons of locals, old timers that seem like they come here daily to read the paper, a chat with the friendly chef and of course, a delicious lunch.

I've seen it on the bus going to work and wanted to give it a try. The place is very cozy and small so not a good place for large parties. The waiter and chef are so great -- real Italians and super friendly.

Unlike other places, they offer free bread and this super yummy roasted garlic dipping oil with chili flakes. We opted for the meat and cheese platter and the spaghetti meatball and squid ink pasta specials to share.

The meatballs were moist and flavorful, the pasta wasn't swimming sauce. The sauce was light with a nice tang, but not overpowering. There was a good amount of seafood in the squid ink pasta, even a whole langostine. The seafood was slightly overcooked, though. The ink pasta tasted like it was freshly made.

We finished our meal with a small slice of spaghetti cake. Yup, you heard it right, it's made with leftover pasta. I loved the texture of it and it's not too sweet. Should definitely give it a try if you're not too stuff.
author: Alice W.

description:
Super cute, small place run by what appear to be authentic (albeit mildly grumpy) Italians that serves outstanding but somewhat-pricey food. I had the mahi special (served with pasta in a wonderfully-rich sauce subtly flavored with capers and tomatos), their peach iced tea (a surprisingly complex and delicious thing), and the port for dessert. Everything was outstanding, even the bread served before the meal (which included a perfect mix of garlic, olive oil, and spices).  

I love the outdoor seating. My main complaint was that I couldn't manage to get a refill on my iced tea...though the food and the atmosphere are great. Totally a good place for special occasions.
author: Chris S.

description: Hole in the wall but very fun and authentic atmosphere.  The service is very friendly and cheerful - makes you think that you are guests at a fun-loving Italian family.  The menu is not big but they have tons of specials.  We especially liked the black fettuccine.
author: Hoai C.

description:
Pre-marathon pasta dinner. Perfect. Simple. Delicious. Great service.

Waitress was sassy and fun.

Bread and olive oil and garlic cloves. Wow. Could live off of that stuff.

Small place. Make reservations or get here early.
author: Aaron C.

description:
4.5 stars? Yelp epic fail.

I stopped going to this place last year and just remembered that I promised myself that I was going to put this on Yelp. 

I have been to Cafe Macaroni twice. 

First experience: I tried the special of the day which was pasta with squids. It was a mediocre 3 stars experience.

*Second experience*: I had 3 friends (my girlfriend and her friends) visiting the city and they asked me to go there. Even though I told them that I did not have a great experience and there are better restaurants in San Francisco, they insisted due to the raving Yelp reviews and outside seating.

The food came, 3 women and myself, none of us enjoyed our pastas. Not even one person thought the food was good. In a city that is well known with their great restaurants, this is unacceptable. However, I would still be giving at least 2 stars (or maybe not write a review at all). What made me to write this review is how the waiter treated us/me. 

First he said that he can only take 1 card for a table of 4. I told him that I don't see anything written about this anywhere (not on the menu or the walls, etc) and he should have let us know this ahead of time. He still did not change his mind and left the bill on table for us to figure out who is going to pay. I picked up the check and went inside because I did not want to argue in front of my girlfriend and her 2 friends. I tried to convince him with no luck. Finally I told him that thanks to this attitude I will probably never come back to this place again. Then I went back outside to our table. My friends asked what happened and I told them that I could not convince him and we need to give one card.

Guess what happened after... After a minute the waiter came out, and shouted at me saying that he does not give a f*** whether I (or "we" since now he is talking in front of my friends) come back or not. My friends were in shock trying to understand what happened since they did not hear our conversation inside. 

Wondering how many stars this behavior deserves ... in the heart of the most touristic city of US... Shame.
author: Gokhan T.

description:
Amazing (and a great value). Squid ink linguine + a glass of vermentino. Done.

The service was lovely. Michele was attentive and pleasant.

Physical space is pretty limited, but I'd rather have an intimate shop with quality product than a big-box place with no personality.
author: Scott H.

description: We are here after reading other Yelp reviews and I am glad we did. The food was delicious and the service was phenomenal. Our waiter seemed to truly enjoy his job and  as a result, our dining experience was fantastic. In addition, the food was amazing! Check it out!
author: Robyn Y.

description:
This place has some of the best Italian food in the city...  Perfectly authentic, casual atmosphere with a true Cafe feel.

The daily specials offerings are sometimes as lengthy as the menu.  Something for everybody!
author: Randy T.

description:
NORTH BEACH EATING PART VI: NEAPOLITAN CUISINE

"Just when I thought I was out, they pull me back in." - Michael Corleone from "The Godfather III".

Sometimes when you keep on looking for new restaurants to eat you revert back to a particular restaurant because of certain items on that menu that intrigued you because you had them in the past or haven't tried them. Well this was the case with me. I came here for two reasons: 1) sea urchin pasta 2) whole roasted branzino. I've had the sea urchin before but I was craving it again. I love the presentation of the pasta in the sea urchin shell. In addition when I ate here for lunch about a month ago I noticed one customer had a whole roasted branzino, which is a Mediterranean sea bass found throughout Italy. The neat thing was Mario filleted the fish right in front of the customer. 

I ate here again last night with the specific mind of having the sea urchin pasta. When I asked Mario if he still sells the sea urchin pasta he said he ran out of fresh sea urchins. He said when he gets fresh sea urchins he will definitely put it on the menu. I did have the backup plan - the whole roasted branzino, which was available. I also asked Mario what kind of pasta will compliment with the branzino and he recommended small spaghetti with garlic while I was waiting for the roasted branzino. 

The spaghetti was perfectly light - it didn't make me full before having the roasted branzino. As usual the pasta was al dente. After eating the spaghetti, arrived the main course. If you want a performance art when you eat observe Mario filleting the branzino right in front of you. It is a great sight to see. Eating the whole fish is much better a fillet because it is juicier. Think of how cooking a whole rotisserie chicken is much different than cooking different parts of the chicken separately. The cool thing is even when Mario fillets the branzino the skin remains crispy. Is it the best fish I ever had? No but it's pretty damn good. Whereas you go to restaurants where they try to be fancy with their fillet fish, the art of roasting a whole fish is a skill that is underappreciated. And if not careful you can overcook the fish just as overcooking a steak.

As with the last time I ate here I gave this a 5-star rating. Mario really looked out for me when he suggested small pasta instead of regular sized pasta that can tend to be huge portions. By having a small pasta I wasn't full when I waited in anticipation for the roasted branzino. 

Grazie Mario.

Mario next time I'll order the sea urchin.
author: Gerald R.

description:
Favorite restaurant in the city by far and here's why

-the food is always delicious and fresh
-the service is amazing and incredibly friendly 
-sometimes they'll end the meal with a complimentary shot 
-the garlic oil sauce for bread dipping is addicting and theyll never stop refilling it for you 
-despite how awesome and highly rated this place is, there is never a wait
author: Derrick W.

description: This is a quaint family run establishment - and every person coming to the door is welcomed and seated ASAP. I recommend making a reservation - as the seating downstairs only seats 10. There is outdoor seating and a low-ceiling extra area upstairs. The food was impeccable and the ambiance was one of a large family get together. Authentic dishes are on the menu, but the daily specials are the ones to get. I would be a regular, if I lived there.
author: Cindy B.

description:
We came to this place because of the high Yelp reviews, but I don't really understand where they came from. 

The service was mediocre at best. We had to ask for water four times before getting any and ended up refilling the glasses ourselves at the suggestion of our server. We were also given a hard time for asking for a second basket of hardly any bread and again for asking for crushed red pepper and salt. Meanwhile people who arrived and ordered after me and my party got their food first.

The food was not very good. I got the baked pasta, which had a lot of cheese, but hardly any sauce. My friends got a mixed pasta with sausage, but there were four small pieces of sausage in it, not very much. Someone else got Mahi Mahi, which was bland and lackluster. The portions over all were very small for the prices paid. If the quality of the food were better it might have been worth it.

Needless to say we were very disappointed and will not be going back. There is another restaurant a couple blocks away that is far superior.
author: Jonathan A.

description:
Very cute restaurant with tiny store front, tiny kitchen, super friendly service, and great cooking! It was really cute, and you can talk to your next table because you're so close to each other. 

The reason for 3-star is for the freshness of seafood. We ordered a squid-ink seafood pasta, it was cooked super well with a gigantic prawn on top which was super tasty. However, the mussels and clams in that pasta weren't fresh. It's a pity because it was cooked well, with lots of flavor. The next table also order the same dish, and when their order came, I thought it smelled really funky - like some smelly cheese or stinky tofu. Not what I would expect in an Italian place. 

We also ordered some calamari with beans and that was super tasty. The tomato with mozzarella and basil was just OK, the tomatoes was quite tasteless.  

I think the problem is this small place tries to have a large menu, so not all the items can be kept at top quality. I would suggest the owners to only offer a small selection with fresh, good quality ingredients. You have great cooks, great location, and great serve staff, the only thing missing is better quality control.
author: Wendy K.

description: Great food, Great ambiance Chef Mario and his wife were wonderful and very interesting. Food recommendations were on point and delicious!!! When in San Fran will definitely be back to eat!!!
author: Rick S.

description: Food was amazing, I wish yelp had a "half-star" option, but this was a solid 4.5. The marinara sauce was so good, I wanted to get a glass to drink of it. I would definitely go back again.
author: Bobby J.

description:
Spring Break 2015 in CA...Oh my...this winner will take some explaining. On the corner of Jackson Street and Columbus Avenue on the border of the Financial and Chinatown districts sits this tiny little café that puts out big food. The owner used to own a place called The Purple Onion across the street ... a joint where a young Bob Dylan among others got a start performing. The owner sold the building when prices got too high to ignore and moved his downsized Italian restaurant to this little closet on the opposite corner.  

Café Macaroni has but five little two-person tables right in the window on the first floor along with its open kitchen...yes that is seating for 10; upstairs under an exceptionally low ceiling there are maybe 15 additional seats - so this restaurant weighs in with seating for roughly 25.  Now to the food...for our table of five that took up most of the first floor.  

For starters we shared two appetizers: Bufala mozzarella (roughly a third of a cup of fresh mozzarella with thin slices of prosciutto)...and their version of bruschetta (nice thick slices of soft Italian bread spread with a spicy olive tapenade and just a hint of tomato rather than a layer of chopped tomato). The main courses here start with a short menu of regular items that is supplemented with a nice array of daily specials...we had two of the specials.

I had the pork belly (special) cooked in fennel (luscious pork belly sliced thin like bacon and served with the thin fennel slices it was simmered with)...one of our party had the spaghetti and meatballs (two large meat balls and very nice al dente noodles)...another had the special pollo giorno with potato gnocchi (the chicken was lovely but the gnocchi melted in your mouth)...another had the cannelloni stuffed with two cheeses in a light tomato sauce (mozzarella and ricotta and wonderful)...and the last had a pasta amiscat amatrice (delightful dish of pasta flavored with pancetta and pecorino cheese).

We complemented dinner with a bottle of chianti and finished with tiramisu...how very Italian. The hit of the dinner were the two servers...both very Italian with thick accents. But you could understand their speech just enough if you paid attention to their hand gestures which accompanied everything they did. When we arrived they pretended to reel us in like fish, and they continued to entertain for the whole evening. They are a real draw for this place as they make dinner a memorable event. 

This place was highly recommended in YELP reviews and I agree. The little restaurant is noisy and the seating is close, but it is a delightful dinner place that can be romantic or just plain fun. Give it a try.
author: Rick B.

description: Pro tip: ask for what's NOT on the menu and they will grin and introduce the secret dishes they have in store that day. The restaurant is small and a little cramped, but I would call it cozy. It reminds me of that scene in Lady and the Tramp, where they go and enjoy spaghetti on a red checkered tablecloth (I know it's not the same, but this place makes me feel warm inside like that scene does).
author: Katherine W.

description: This dinner was perfect! I wanted to get there early to make sure we could get seated. We were greeted and seated quickly at a very nice corner table. This restaurant is tiny but not short on character! We had our bread and drinks within minutes. We ordered caprese salad. The mozzarella was perfect with the tomatoes, basil and olive oil. I ordered the seafood risotto , it was perfect. Risotto can be a challenging thing and sometimes it comes out stick but this was just right and full of clams, mussels, calamari and delectable fish pieces. I tasted my husbands gnocchi and chicken scallopini. It was so very good! We shared tiramisu afterwards and I think it was the best I've ever had . Great dinner!! Cannot wait to return!
author: Lesley F.

description: Just terrible. The waiter was loud, obnoxious and over bearing. We had to literally beg him over and over again to bring parts of our order. He totally did not leave us alone to catch up with family members and kept imposing himself on us and spoiling our conversation. The decor in this place is dated and food is average at best. I'm shocked at the positive ratings and comments others have left. I'm European so perhaps my standards are too high. Would not recommend.
author: Nisha H.

description: My husband and I came here on Valentine's Day and it was such a fun experience with amazing food! Definitely an authentic Italian experience. The seating area is small but I felt like that was part of the charm. Go here if you want incredible pasta.
author: C N.

description:
Miguel was our waiter and such a delight! We enjoyed the calamari & white beans as well as the arugula salad, which was a bit too oily for me. Then we had the Gorgonzola gnocchi which was delicious, but the Gorgonzola was a bit strong so I probably couldn't eat this as a main dish on my own. We also got the black linguine with seafood, which was quite good as well. 

We had the tiramisu, which I could pass on, but it seemed homemade. 

Overall, wonderful service that was personable and funny/fun. I enjoyed the overall experience and the quirky decor/ red walls with short ceilings upstairs.
author: Sau y.

description: Amazing!  Just like my Italian grandmother used to make. Small but intimate and everything from scratch. Fresh and authentic.
author: Melanie L.

description: We ate here tonight and it is as authentic Italian as you can get outside of Italy. Every dish from the calamari, pizza, linguini with many, many muscles and clams were fantastic. The Petrale was cooked perfectly and the flavors surrounding it were perfectly balanced. Mario suggested a beautiful Sangiovese that complemented the entire meal. We usually don't get desserts, but we couldn't pass up the homemade tiramisu, lemon cake and one more item that my mother refused to share with me so I never got to taste it. And the owners obviously love what they do and we loved them. Our favorite Italian restaurant in San Francisco!!!
author: John B.

description:
I would give it 5 except for my wife's pasta and mine were undercooked.  Kinda ruined it but the taste of the food was impeccable.  Service was top notch, very friendly, very hip.  

The place is very small I think it had 4-two person tables inside and a few tables outside.   Check out our picks to see what we ate.
author: John C.

description:
Caffe Macaroni! This was such a fun experience and I will definitely return here in the future. Caffe Macaroni is as close as you can get to an authentic Italian experience, without being in Italy. From the food, to the staff, to the atmosphere, this restaurant really goes above and beyond. 

The waiters are extremely nice and know what they are doing. The menu is all typical Italian dishes. I had the Seafood Pasta, which I would highly recommend. Caffe Macaroni is a small place, so you may have to wait a bit before you get a table. They have both indoor and outdoor seating - I recommend the outdoor if the weather is warm enough.
author: Aletta B.

description: Outstanding! My husband had the seafood risotto, which was very good. My chicken scallopini with potato gnocchi was out of this world! Coffee & cannoli, very nice. Small, authentic Italian - a real find.
author: Jenna M.

description: Super cool sit down, enjoy yourself Italian spot. Tortellini, maccheronata and gnocchi were on point. Wine is reasonably priced. Highly recommend this spot! Would make for a fun date.
author: Crystal T.

description:
Caffe Macaroni is the kind of Italian restaurant you always dreamed about, but never believe existed. Red vinyl seats, tight quarters, red stripper heals above your head, a nice Italian man that greets you before you even walk in... yeah, they have it all.

After rallying up some of the Community Ambassadors, we ventured through the area in search of a highly-rated restaurant that would be able to sit us on the drop of a dime. CM was only a few blocks from where we were staying and The Big Storm of 2014 hadn't started yet so walking was still an option. I was gabbing away so when an enthusiastic man with a heavy Italian accent and friendly smile invite us into Caffe Macaroni, I just assumed we got tired of walking and were going in... little did I know this spot had actually been preselected by a couple of the other Ambassadors. CM does have an almost perfect rating and I can see why. I love a business that's not scared to invite people in from off the streets when they have some tables open or are having a slow night.

Our group was seven or eight-ish big so it's worth noting CM is hella small. We were seated downstairs and combined almost all of the two seat tables they had to accommodate our group. The mirrors on the back wall did help to open up the space. It turned out they do have space upstairs, but I'm not entirely sure how much so if you have any more than five people in your group I'd say call ahead.

No macaroni... oh the irony. Somehow that made me love the name more. I settled on the Penne All Amatriciana (which I had to verify the pronunciation with the server). This place is Italian through and through. It would've taken me a bit to recite the menu aloud.

We were brought bread and olive oil with balsamic vinaigrette during our wait and I probably ate more than my share. Before we knew it, our food had arrived. My penne was cooked perfectly and the sauce was impeccable. And the pancetta... the pancetta! Yes, just do this! I think I stole off of everyone's plate and everything was delicious.

The only downfall of the night was the bill. Not the price, but when we asked for the checks we were given one for our group. And after it was brought we immediately let them know the bill needed to be separate. To which we found out couldn't be done. I've worked with a ton of different credit card machines... you can always cancel a check and start over... always. And they wouldn't allow us to use multiple cards (which that I understand). The whole paying escapade put a little damper on the night, but all in all I loved CM and I'm sure next time I'm in the area I'll be making a stop.
author: Tanya Y.

description: Best Italian restaurant in San Francisco! I can't believe I didn't write a review sooner. My dad works around the corner, so I've been here 80-100 times, including when they also had the location across the street. Mario always has creative menu items, based on whatever fresh proteins and produce he finds, and everything is to die for. Whether it's buffalo ragu, sea urchin, fresh burrata, or traditional spaghetti and meatballs, you need to plan your next Italian night here!
author: Ali S.

description:
Mario was an absolute delight. Regardless of being the owner of the establishment he took the time to speak to my date and I about the menu. He also told us about himself, his wife Stephanie, and his family which gave me a very nostalgic feeling of home. Atmosphere is important when going out and the amount of attention & care really made me want to come back

Now in regards to the food I order the calamari, pork belly, baby octopus, squid ink, and spaghetti marinara. Everything was absolutely on point! The pork was juicy even though it could have easily been dry if left to cook for a minute more, the seafood tasted amazingly fresh, and the pasta was impeccable. 

My favorite was definitely the baby octopus! Oh and you can bring your own wine bottle!!!
author: Christopher C.

description:
I love this place. It is a tiny authentic Italian restaurant with great food and character.

I have some wonderful meals here. This is not an Americanized place. It makes you feel like you are in italy as you sit on Columbus Ave.
author: David T.

description:
This is certainly a restaurant deserving of accolades.  They are highly rated by Zagats.  

The atmosphere is outstanding, the service is superb. The two dish we we had, one a chicken and gnocchi, and the linguine with seafood were generous, and delicious.  Our appetizer,  Muzzerla y Mulignan was brilliant.
author: Philip H.

description: Squid ink seafood pasta was good but the loud upstairs and 2 bugs seen crawling around upstairs ruined it for me
author: Kevin Y.

description: I began to worry that these glowing reviews were fake when I was desperate for a last minute reservation on a Saturday night and this place was wide open on OpenTable. Next time I'll use my head--actual great spots don't have tons of open reservations. The waitstaff was friendly but inattentive and the food was the worst Italian I've ever had. The bread was by far the best thing we had.  With so many wonderful spots in North Beach, you'll do better to go elsewhere, even if there's a long wait.
author: Char M.

description:
I was on a business trip and looking for a place to eat by myself.  The owner and the server made me feel like family.  Small hole in the wall restaurant, but wonderful service and a beautiful atmosphere.  The owner gave me a kiss on the cheek on the way out. I appreciated that they went out of their way to make me feel like an honored guest even though I was by myself and didn't order alcohol.  

Also: accepts corporate Amex cards
author: Alice W.

description: Amazing! Mario was fantastic - we let him pick our whole dinner for our 28th wedding anniversary - What a treat! Wow - can't say enough good stuff about the staff - very friendly - you won't be disappointed - We can't wait to go back - Thanks for a great Time!!!!
author: Jack K.

description: After my 2nd visit I am still thinking about their black linguine pasta! It is really addicting. Fresh seafood and white wine really blends everything together.
author: Jessica Y.

description: Very good Italian restaurant in North Beach. I love how this is such a family business. I heard some people coming to visit saying we got to go to "Mario's place", then Mario was serving me. Lots of good stuff on and off the menu as specials. Good osso buco and good wine.
author: Peter K.

description:
One reviewer called this place "magical," they're correct.  Stopped in randomly for lunch while visiting the city. The food was great and the atmosphere was more than memorable.  

Seriously, I've never felt so welcomed by a restaurant... And I've only been once.... And it was over a year ago!  Writing a review now because I needed a romantic spot for Valentine's Day and I couldn't think of another place in the world I'd like to take my lady to.  We're traveling from LA!  Crazy, but I'm so excited to make it back to this little restaurant and spend a special evening in a truly special place.
author: Antone H.

description:
Stopped by Caffe Macaroni last night for dinner.  The food was the best since I've had since Italy.  Everything we tried was superb and homemade.  We started with lentil soup which was seasoned to perfection, hot and perfect for the rainy eve.  Followed by marinated anchovies, burrata salad - both were yummy. Squid ink pasta with seafood which was amazing.  The pasta was so light and the seafood perfectly cooked and presented. We also had ravioli with pesto which just melted in my mouth.  For dessert, we tried their Tiramisu - just perfect!

The server was awesome.  He was very sweet, from the beautiful city of Roma!  When he found out that my daughter could speak a bit Italian, he brought up some Limoncello shots for us.  Made for a fun night.  If you want authentic Italian food and atmosphere, don't miss this place.  Awesome!

BTW we were having dinner in their upstairs room.  That's an experience all of it's own.
author: Irina N.

description: I took a recommendation on Yelp and was thrilled!   I have had the best Chinese food in India, best Indian food in England and now best Italian food in the US.   Small, quaint and a great eating experience.  Will definitely make it back here every time I am in town.  Octopus pasta will be my go to dish
author: Ottmf P.

description: So seriously this place was ridiculous good. My wife and I left the kids at home, got a hotel and decided to get some dinner before a crazy night of keeping the neighbors awake...but I just want to go back in for more food.  Yah its better than sex good. The place is tiny and intimant and the waitress yells things i dont understand in italian which is damn cool, and sexy. So hell yah. I am going back.  I dont even know what I oredered. Actually I do, it was black, squid ink linguine with a bunch of seafood.  . You already know I liked it. My wife had some pasta that looked great too and she swears it was great so I will take her word for it. And the deserts were great too.  Cheers.
author: b t.

description:
Lunched here.

Antipasti, pizza, panini, pasta.
We had it all!  The food was fantastic. The ambiance was lovely. Tiny, tiny little place.

Would have given five stars, but we ordered Sangiovese and they slipped is a cab sauv instead. (Yes, we confirmed by looking at the bottle.)
author: Jazmyne H.

description: We discovered this gem of a restaurant at the end of the Chinese New Year Parade route.  With its outdoor seating we had a perfect view of the parade but the best part was the delicious food and super friendly staff!  Warm thanks to Mario & Stephanie for taking care of us with our four little children and making sure our tummies were full of deliciousness.  Even our pickiest eater said "I wish I ordered some other than cheese pizza because everyone else's food was so good too!"  We will definitely be back to try other items on the menu -- although everything we had was awesome.  Thank you!!!
author: Max T.

description: Totally unexpected close knit home cooking experience. The chef and his wife were the most entertaining in this authentic Italian hidden gem.
author: Grennan K.

description:
Once a week, I find myself indulging at Caffe Macaroni. It is a true italian gem.

Chef Mario and his team are so warm and friendly, I always leave the restaurant happy and buzzed from their delicious Napoli white wine "Falanghina" :D

My favorite starters are:

* Porchetta with braised fennel (when available)  Absolutely delicious.. Just like how they do it in Rome! 
* Burrata cheese - pair this with their tomato focaccia bread
* Clams & Mussels

Do not miss:

* Breaded Sardine spaghetti
* Baby Octopus spaghetti
* Lamb ragout pappardelle with ricotta (when available)

They also do a wonderful Branzino which Chef Mario fillets table side!

If you have a sweet tooth, Don't forget their Ricotta barley cake and pair it with their super yum panna cotta!
author: Amber S.

description: After reading the Yelp reviews, we really wanted to like this place. We were disappointed. The place is really small and quaint and has all the makings of a little piece of Italy in San Francisco. But that's about all we liked. The  table and chairs were sticky - not sure when they were last wiped down or cleaned. Service was slow...really slow. And the best of the worst... the good. Do not order the pizza. I don't know where they get their pizza but it is NOT like any pizza I have ever tasted. Hard crust that seemed old. The sausage was bland and tasteless. If you like pizza, avoid this place. The pasta was decent... oh, the other authentic part of this place.  The attitude. The staff seemed tired and have no patience to make your dining experience pleasurable.
author: Alidad V.

description:
This place is so good. The squid ink pasta with shellfish is my favorite! This is probably the best Italian food I've had in San Francisco. Every single pasta dish our group ordered was really good. I especially liked my boyfriend's gnnochi. It was in a really good creamy sauce. We also got Burrata and foccacia for appetizers and it was perfect. I especially like the all italian staff; our waiter was hilarious, when we could understand what it was that he was saying haha.

It's a very small restaurant so groups are not ideal.
author: Irina M.

description: I visited this place based on many positive reviews and I would give it an average rating.  We made a reservation and arrived on time.  I started to walk in the door behind a waitress that was waiting on a table outside.  I figured I needed to check in.  She turned around and rudely asked "can I help you" as though I was intruding or doing something wrong.  I told her we had a reservation and she rudely told me should couldn't help me but the owner Mario would be down when he could to handle things.  I'd have been okay with it had she been nice about it.  It was an immediate turn off.  It didn't take long and we were seated.  The place is small both upstairs and down.  It's very loud too so if you are trying to have a conversation, it may pose a challenge if you don't hear well.  Our waiter was very nice and worked to take care of us.  Mario and the rude woman were visible but were very focused on catering to specific customers and never came to our table as mentioned by many in the reviews.  The food we had was decent but I sadly I can get just as good or way better at a local family run Italian establishment in my hometown.    I would tell others who may be considering dining there is that it will be average and manage your expectations accordingly.  It has been around for a long time so a bit of a fixture for that neighborhood.   Definitely an interesting experience though I'm not sure I would make it a priority to return.
author: Jeff H.

description: This was hands down the best Italian meal we have had outside of Italy!!! Our motto is, the smaller the place, the better the food. We had the tortellini with cream sauce and peas and ham, it was spectacular. The owner and waiter are from Rome and have such a thick accent and kind demeanor, we thought we were actually in Italy. We even each got a free shot as a thank you for being so kind with our amazing waiter. We relaxed and weren't rushed to leave and before we knew it it had already been 2 hours. If you're looking for no tourists, quality authentic food, and a comfortable romantic setting, this is the place to go!
author: Noelle B.

description:
OMG this place is GOOD GOOD GOOD.
Charming, quirky, a bit off the tourist path and divinely delicious. I can't believe we haven't been before, but this is now our go-to Italian restaurant in SF.  I won't think of going anywhere else! 

The dining room is cozy and welcoming. Service was wonderful and the entire staff is a delight. Our meals were TDF and I want to try everything on the menu. Over and over. I had a seafood pasta that was super yummy. My better half had a pumpkin/chicken papardelle that was fantastic. And tiramisu for dessert that was heavenly.

Run don't walk to Caffe Macaroni!
author: Carl M.

description:
WOW WOW WOW!  This place really is as good as it gets.  

Got into town and went straight here to meet with the family.  Ordered 3 appetizers, all so delicious! I'm not even sure what we ordered, pretty much just told Mario to bring us things.  

I had the spaghetti and meatballs, I just kept it original since I was overwhelmed by so many delicious options and specials.  Such big tasty meatballs.  I also tried bites of everyone else's food... that's a totally normal thing for girls to do right??  the squid ink pasta was by far my favorite of everyone's food.
author: Christina P.

description:
This was an experience to be sure.  The place is super small.  Downstairs is practically a storefront only-maybe three tables of four.  Very steep staircase to an upstairs area, low ceilings, a wall of mirrors (to make it look bigger) and painted red walls and seating for a total of maybe 25.  Waiter was boisterous with a heavy accent adding to the color of the place. 

The menu at the restaurant seemed different than what was posted online so what I was intending to order I had to rethink. Ended up ordering pasta with sausage, peppers and onions in a red sauce.  The pasta noodles were different sizes which was kind of interesting and done to a perfect aldente.  The sauce was ok, didn't care for the sausage and the portion size was on the small side (but probably better that way-I could have easily eaten twice as much). Consider getting a salad and appetizer to round it out.
 
I ordered a glass of Pinot noir and received a Sangiovese which was not pointed out to me.  It took a bit of doing to get the wine as it was he brought it to me after my pasta arrived.

Overall I enjoyed the food and experience, but thought others might like to be aware of what to expect.
author: Laurie S.

description: service is good. place is very small but quaint and cute.  my food is kind of ok (since I am gluten free and have very limited options, probably didnt try their best), but my friends enjoyed their food.
author: Shuting Z.

description: Loved this place. The food was in my lifetime top 10 Italian meals. Pasta was fresh and amazing. Salad was creative and fun. It's a small place and we were fortunate enough to sit next to a crazy octogenarian couple who have been dating for 30 years. For whatever reason on that night, she declared it was time to marry. His artful dodges were absolutely hilarious. Food and fun!
author: Ken M.

description:
My family had booked a week-long getaway in SF and I was driving up with my gf. We decided to take the scenic route - you know, the 101 to the 1 at Morro Bay, riding the coast up for 123 miles to Monterey before cutting back over to the 101 - and it must have taken us a solid 11 hours or so, what with stops for food and bathroom breaks and leg stretching and all. It was a long haul, worth it, but very time consuming. And draining. 

What the hell does any of that have to do with Italian food? Because my parents, brother, cousin and his fiance were all waiting here for us, so we literally went from a half-day's drive straight into a seat here. Thankfully, Mario and his band of servers were so ebullient it got me back on my game in no time. My dad eats here whenever he's in the city, and being a fellow Italian he and Mario have become good friends, so our experience may have been a little more personal than most but that isn't to say anyone walking in off the street wouldn't be treated just as well. 

We began with wine. What else? Mario brought out a trio of appetizers for the table to munch on, including calamari, black mussels, and burrata cheese. I'm a big seafood eater and all of this was absolutely exquisite. Lots of bold flavoring and complementary flavors. But all this was merely a warm-up to the main course. 

I never even looked at a menu. Mario ran down the night's specials and mentioned a black pasta dish with mussels, fish, scallops... basically all the things I wanted to eat at that moment in time in a bowl together. Black pasta is fantastic, by the way. Definitely get some if you see it offered. Not saying it'll blow your mind or anything, just that it's different enough to warrant trying. Every morsel of sea-dwelling creature contained within this large bowl of beauty was divine. Mario and his guys know how to do amazing traditional Italian and this dish exemplified what that's all about. 

A couple desserts and an espresso later, I needed to be wheeled out on a gurney. There isn't a single complaint to be filed here. Not only was the food stupendous but Mario and his team were all personable and attentive.
author: Anthony A.

description:
My friend had been eyeing this place for awhile and really wanted to come and give it a try.  She suggested I read the Yelp reviews before agreeing.  The reviews looked promising.  So I said yes.

We came for lunch today.  There's five tables indoors each one table for two. And several outdoor tables. Great if warm and sunny.  But I'm feeling claustrophobic indoors already.  One guy in the corner with the best seat in the house.  And another table with two elderly gents.  And then us.

Two glasses of water brought to the table.  Mine has a dead bug floating. Not a good start.

A bread basket with chopped garlic in olive oil for dipping looked promising.  That turned out to be our highlight. 

My friend ordered the penne pasta.  She thought too salty and not enough pasta.

I ordered the Margherita pizza.  I looked around the small kitchen and didn't notice a pizza oven.  That should have been a clue.  My pizza comes on a board. It resembled focaccia bread, with the bread bottom toasted.  

We paid $18.00 each inc tax & tip.  Not worth it.  We left very dissatisfied.

The server was quick to give us our bill and quick to collect.  We give him two $20s and he comes back with two fives.  We gave him $5.00 tip.

Overall 2.5-3.0 stars.
author: Shirley N.

description:
Caffè Macaroni oozes charm and authenticity. The waiters were fun and friendly, and I had a blast practicing my Italian with them. 

We ordered 5 dishes and split them: panzanella (bread) salad, calamari with beans, seafood with squid ink linguine, cod with peppers and potatoes, and a delicious rum cake for dessert. Everything was fresh and absolutely delicious -- even the coffee. The digestif on the house was a sweet way to end the evening.

Thanks to Mario and his wonderful team, Caffè Macaroni has become a San Francisco favorite. Grazie!
author: Aleece G.

description: I had the pasta with sardines.  I have to say this is majorly over hyped.   The pasta was not fresh and the sardines were meh.  The wait service was adequate.  The garlic oil with bread was tasty but nothing memorable.   This meal reminded me of tourist italian food - expensive and meh.  Try the Trestle next door for a better quality/value meal.  It's nouveau California.
author: robert s.

description:
This is my second time to this place and I love the food here

Ambience : It's cozy but could get crampy for some people who are not used to it. People are seated quite closely with tables quite near each other . Expect a three on a table for two. I however am ok with it because it seems like a home environment with everyone chatting and having fun. Love the low roof setting.

Food and drinks : Perfect spices in the italian good . One of the best I have eaten . Wide variety of wine and yummy tiramisu . Definitely must try 

Service : The place is pretty crowded . Service is friendly but it does take time which I don't think is a big deal considering you can have a nice plate of appetizer of cheese and cold cut meat and wine while the mains arrive 

One of my favourite Italian joints in the area
author: Nupur S.

description:
My boyfriend and I come here almost weekly and it is our favorite Italian restaurant in the city! We recommend this place to all of our friends.

Maria and his team greet us like family and the service is amazing! We order the Aglio e Olio with the steak and it never disappoints. 

Pay them a visit, you will not be disappointed!
author: Claudia S.

description: Reasonable prices for wines, excellent food, great ambiance and friendly wait staff and owner. My husband and I were lucky to get an outside table as the sun was setting, and watch the world go by. Wonderful! We felt like family. We weren't rushed and the food was delicious. We will be back!
author: Cindy R.

description: Stumbled upon and so glad we did.   Tiny place with huge personality and excellent traditional Italian cuisine.
author: Troy F.

description:
Got drawn into this cute little old school trattoria because of its uni pasta! Yes, by little, I mean tiny. There is only enough space on the first floor for three tables inside and two small tables outside. There is an upstairs area that I haven't seen, but it's probably just as cozy. 

The uni pasta did not disappoint! I was actually sad that I had to share it with my friends during dinner. I wanted it all for myself! 

We also tried the porchetta, which I didn't like as much. I'm not one to shy away from fatty meat, in fact, I love fatty steak, but this was beyond greasy. I felt like I was drinking bacon oil. 

I was slightly disappointed by the bread they served before the meal as well. I was expecting piping hot fresh-baked Italian bread, but instead we got a generic stale and cold french baguette. The olive oil with marinaded chopped garlic that came with the bread made up for it a little though. 

I would come back though just for the uni pasta if I happen to be in the area.
author: Catherine C.

description:
We stopped by here for dinner on a whim.  We have passed by a so many times for years.  We were surprised we found a table as it seems like a tiny place (later found they also have a upstairs)

The printed menu was standard but then we heard about all the specials and fell in love. 
- burrata appetizer the freshest we ever tasted
- petrole sole delicious and tender
- shellfish squid ink pasta : subtle and perfect.  Sauce is just slightly spicy too
Ended with their barley pie which was surprisingly moist and some cannoli

We will definitely be back. ;-) yummy.
author: Lei H.

description:
Delicious.  Great menu, great staff (the kind that you want to take a photo with before you go), and amazing food.  Showed up with a party of 11 or so without a reservation, and they pushed some tables together outside to make room for us.  Chefs are happy to just make you something cool with minimal direction if you want.

I ended up ordering pasta with a buttery sauce and squid.  Simple stuff, but prepared perfectly and so so tasty.  I don't recall what my friends ordered, but everyone else ended up being thrilled as well.
author: Brian T.

description:
Don't let the goofy name deceive you. This food is freaking delicious! Although I could only understand about 20% of what the Italian waiters/owners said, I was more than pleased with some of the most delicious food ever in the former Little Italy of San Francisco. 

We had some fresh octopus appetizer that was amazing. I had the chicken parm and he had spaghetti and meatballs. We finished it off by splitting a calzone. 

The service was nice, and the food was amazing. The only downside is the front entrance of the cafe is super cramped so you're only about 4" away from your neighbors.  I believe there is an upstairs though.

I would come back, for sure! Incredibile! (yes, that's Italian for incredible).
author: Jennifer A.

description: This is the worst Italian restaurant experience I have ever had. The food was disgusting. We ordered a seafood linguine dish, all it came with was clams and mussels that don't even taste fresh. I was glad I didn't have food poisoning after eating there. The waitress offered to switch us with the squid ink pasta dish which would have more seafood. It costed $7 more, but we wanted to switched it so bad and hoped it would be a better one. We were disappointed again, the dish is still lacked the taste. My sister kept biting on some small sand pieces from the pasta.. She wasn't able to eat at all. The other chicken dish we ordered was very salty and way too creamy. All you can taste is old cheese. The service was also speechless... The waitress didn't introduce us any of their specialty of the day or even the menu. I felt we were just not being treated equally as we observed she was much more attentive to the two older guys sitting next to us. Our experience here was so bad and won't return again!
author: Shao H.

description: If you know it's going to be a warm evening in San Francisco, do yourself a favor and make a reservation to sit outside at Caffe Macaroni. You'll feel like you've found a little slice of Italy. We had a delicious burrata salad, sole, and a ravioli. Everything was superb. The portion sizes are generous, too. For dessert we shared a fantastic tarmisu and espresso. The service is funny, friendly, and on top of everything.
author: Mark S.

description:
Took my daughter and 5 friends to lunch for her birthday. The food was A-MAZ-ING! Seriously. Everything we had was phenomenal. So much flavor. So authentic. I haven't tasted Italian food this tasty and good since I was actually in Italy a couple of years ago. The past was perfect and the tiramisu was heaven.

The interior is VERY small. We went at an off-time or I don't know that our group would have easily gotten a table. As it was, we pretty much filled the restaurant. There may have been 1 or 2 other tables (for two) inside. There are also a handful of tables outside.

The owner (chef?) was friendly and hands-on.

But, did I mention the food? Fabulous! I would go back in a heartbeat.
author: Tamara E.

description:
The foods are really good, and dont forget to ask for their squid ink pasta.
all waiters/waitress can speak Italian apparently, and they for sure have their Italian spirit when talking with customers, really fun to interact with them

just a minor thing: the place is really small, and too crowded. not really good for babies or little kids
author: Raul A.

description:
One of my favorite Italian restaurants in all of SF! While north beach is full of them, few feel so personal and familial and authentic as this place. The service is super friendly and all the staff is just very welcoming and warm. I always leave with a smile with just the service alone...

Then, there's the food- it's simply excellent. And what I mean is that I've gotten what I would consider to be dishes with simpler ingredients and somehow they all taste super super wonderful. I am typically someone that likes to get dishes and meals that are really different and unique, but I don't apply this rule to Caffe Macaroni.

Definitely try this place. You won't be upset!...

Just watch yourself going up and down the stairs... lowwww ceiling upstairs- but quite a unique dining experience :)
author: Magda M.

description:
Came here with a family of four and barely fit into the booths. Small and personal, but the staff makes you feel like you're at home. Penne was delicious, but every dish we got was different and fantastic in its own way. Dinner started with wonderful bread and olive oil to dip. Make sure to get the artichoke if you are a fan of it (it was the best I've ever had). 

I've been to Italy, and the pasta tastes the same if not better. Would recommend to anyone visiting San Fran.
author: Katie O.

description:
OH MAN OH MAN!!! What amazing food they have. I am not sure why they have a menu, because our server Micheal (spoken in Italian) asked each of us what we wanted to eat, we described what our taste buds were in the mood for and the kitchen made it. I had a spicy bolognese sauce...the best that I have Ever had!  The atmosphere is tiny, quaint and very friendly!  If ever in SF again, Cafe Macaroni is 100% on my list of things to do.

Thank you to the Cafe Macaroni staff for such a great dinner, and a great experience!
author: R G.

description: Great low key place. Food is rustic but very good. I had the squid ink linguine and my wife had the gnocchi. The food was very fresh and delicious. We sat outside and the staff was really warm and welcoming. Mario and Michele really made us feel like family and it seems like a lot of the people dining were locals and repeat diners who were greeted with warm hellos and hugs - I can definitely see why they come back. If you're visiting San Fran this is a great place to have dinner. It's a small place so do yourself a favor and make a reservation on OpenTable. If it's a Friday, you should get there early (before 7:30).
author: Christian R.

description:
The pappardelle bolognese was very good. The sauce was a little sour, which is my favorite type of red sauce. It had so much flavor.

The spaghetti and meatballs were the best I ever had. The meatballs were soooo good, and tender meatballs. Not hard and rubbery. The marinara was also a little sour and very flavorful.

We had the tiramisu, and holy crap I was shocked. It was amazing. We just returned from Italy a few weeks ago and it reminded me of the best tiramisu I had there, which was in Florence. 

This place was delicious, I would def return!!
author: Foodfinatic B.

description:
Plus for the cute interior and friendly staff.
My food was just okay - maybe I didn't order well.  I got the pizza/focaccia thing. There was too much crust and not enough yumminess for my liking.
We all got cannoli for dessert.  The powdered chocolate on the ends was a bit too much - the bitterness of the pure cocoa overshadowed the sweetness of the cannoli filling.
author: O C.

description: My family had a fabulous dinner here last night. Michaele made our time with them thoroughly fun and gave us lots of attention. The food and funky red second story dining area were great!
author: Andrea W.

description: This restaurant was so cute and absolutely delicious! I had the pesto linguine which was great, and the waiter was so easy going and friendly.
author: Jackie P.

description: So charming, cozy, unique and delightful. I love this place. I had spaghetti and meatballs- a classic. Left full and happy.
author: Kristin T.

description:
Oh 20-minute-ago-self. Why did you eat all that bread and garlicky olive oil?

We needed that space for this marvelous Chicken Scallopini with Gorgonzola Gnocchi, and now our wife is offering us more of her delicious Squid Ink Linguine Di Mare...

A curse of lethargy upon you 20-minute-ago self, and may your absurdly overstuffed belly serve as a lesson to all who follow!
author: Corey B.

description: As it's the site of our first date ten years ago, this cozy, authentic restaurant will always hold a special spot in our hearts.  Revisiting this weekend did not disappoint!  Everything we have ever ordered is SO fresh and very flavorful that my wife and I have a hard time choosing.  We always trade plates back and forth to get a good variety.
author: Nick V.

description: A trip deep into Italy! The staff, atmosphere, food, and drink transported us into authentic Italy (not touristy Florence, Rome, or Venice). We ordered mostly off-menu specials which were fantastic. The staff took great care of us and treated us tourists as well as their regulars who you could tell came quite often. Definitely our favorite food experience in San Francisco!
author: Victoria D.

description: Authentic Italian food. Don't play around anywhere else,just go here and you'll be on cloud nine.
author: Avery S.

description: Fun place. Cozy seating. Waiter was hilarious. Food was very good. Every review raves about their squid ink pasta which is loaded with shellfish, small octopus and squid.  Definitely call ahead if going with a group larger than 4, otherwise prepare to wait.
author: J. K.

description: AMAZING. Ask Mario what's special you might get Elk Ragu or Blue Fin Tuna or Squid Ink Pasta. Seasonal and rare proteins that are amazing. Great setting for people watching. Lemoncello desert drink and the deserts are fantastic.
author: Heber S.

description:
The black linguine is such a small dish, not enough for my lunch, and tastes plain. Can't believe it is 4.5 star in yelp. And the price tag is definitely more than just "$$". I had got better linguine with double the amount and better flavor at the same price in time squre in Manhattan.

But the waitor is very nice. And the street view is good.
author: Yin W.

description: Tiny tiny place but the food is packed with flavor! Very authentic and worth EVERY bite.
author: Elisa A.

description:
Below average diner. Linguine al mare way too salty and oily with spices that definitely don't come from Italy. 
Before that I had mozzarella which was ok but nothing make me come back.
author: Karl P.

description:
My fiancée loves Italian and we were in town for a romantic weekend getaway, so we found Caffe Macaroni on Yelp.  We showed up on a Saturday night, and after a short wait punctuated by humorous conversation with the employees, we were seated on one edge of a a big hemispheric table upstairs.

I ordered a pizzaccia (pizza on focaccia) with a Peroni and my fiancée had spaghetti and meatballs with a white wine sangria.  We both had the lentil soup to start, and we finished with the tiramisu and cannoli.  Everything was delicious and the upstairs was a cozy area to sit (but don't stand too quickly with the low ceilings!).

At some point while we ate, another couple was seated at the other end of the same table, so we started chatting.  He had just flown back from Intel, so they were having their own romantic city getaway before driving home.  They also enjoyed their meals (squid ink pasta and I don't remember what else), so everyone was very happy with the place.  Once we had all finished, we waited a bit for our checks, and eventually the other couple said their goodbyes and got up to leave, saying they'd just pay downstairs.  When we got our check later, it just had a blank slip inside.  The other couple had picked up our check!  And we have no way to thank them.  Well, thank you Caffe Macaroni and thank you mysterious, generous couple!  We had a great time, great food, and great conversation - all with a surprise twist.  Now we'll just have to pay it forward.
author: Matt B.

description:
This is probably the best "real"
Home made Italian restaurant I have ever been to. Small cafe in a corner, few tables on the second floor but the service is OUTSTANDING, the food is full of flavors and freshness. It is now my favorite Italian and I definitely be coming back here regularly.  We had the cannelloni( awesome), the calamari and mozzarella as fresh and yummy as you could dream of.  For dessert the limoncello cake.... Phenomenal!!
author: ingrid s.

description:
Not only was this a charming little Italian eatery with wonderfully sweet and flirty service, the food was GOOD!  My friend and I shared the spaghetti and meatballs. The Meatballs were huge!!!! They were tender and very tasty, the best Iv had thus far!  The sauce was a touch salty, but still tasty!  We LOVED the bread with garlic and olive oil dip!  
The service from ALL the staff is 5 STARS, the food fell just short of the service, but not by much!  I wish I had some of those meatballs rt NOW!
author: Michelle B.

description:
Rounded up my 3.5 stars to 4 stars because the owner is a great guy. My boyfriend and I made plans to come here after reading such great reviews of the place. We turned the corner and saw the owner standing outside greeting people and welcoming them into his restaurant. Actually a great tactic because a lot of people came in. It is a very small place though. Seating can only accommodate 10-12 people max. I think there was some seating available outside too.

We were seated and given menus. We weren't asked about our drink order until 10 minutes later. They only have one server, so I gave them some leeway, but then it took another 10 minutes to get our water! Eventually, the owner took over as our waiter and it was a smooth ride the rest of dinner. 

The food is very delicious, but imo, not 5 star quality delicious though. My boyfriend liked his dish more than I liked mine. I can't remember the name of his, but it had sausage and broccoli rabe with tomato sauce. I got the pasta carbonara. Basically penne vodka but the sauce was just creamier. I found my dish to be too oily. The portions are also insanely small. Kind of like expensive restaurant quantity. I think they judge portions based on how you look physically, I am small, but I eat a lot of food, a lot more than most people would think. My boyfriend's dish was bigger than mine and the guy at the table next to us had the same dish as my boyfriend, but it was basically double the size! He was older and more on the heavier side. But again, just my theory, take it with a grain of salt (that's a saying right?) 

Overall, good food with nice atmosphere. If I'm ever in SF again, don't think I'll be coming back though. Probably will try a different Italian restaurant.
author: May C.

description:
Came here for lunch on a weekday. Ordered a basic tomato basil evoo spaghetti. It was delicious. Usually I don't finish my entire plate but I cleaned up my plate this time!

There was outside seating and limited seating available inside when I came at around 12pm. It is very small but cozy. 

The bread they served was a bit hard but the  olive oil + garlic spread was excellent. 

The service was also great. I will probably come back.
author: Ena Y.

description: Super authentic. The food is great and the chef and waiter are both Italian. Went on a double date here with my wife and a couple friends. Had a great time in this cozy restaurant. My wife and I went the seafood route and ordered the swordfish and squid ink pasta. We shared so I know both were delicious. If you're looking for great Italian food, you need to check this place out for sure.
author: Alexander T.

description:
Came here for lunch with my husband, mum and baby - we sat outside and were pleasantly surprised. The service was attentive and friendly and the owner was there and said hi. It's a lovely friendly place and the food is great - simple, delicious Italian. 
We had the calamari appetizer which was cooked with tomato, rocket and beans - it was fresh, perfectly cooked, simple and tasty. My husband had the spaghetti with sardines and chilli which was yummy and my mum had the shellfish linguine which she enjoyed. I had a simple pasta with pesto which was garlicky and delicious. All our pasta was perfectly cooked al dente and we washed it down with a glass of prosecco - perfect for a quick simple sunny lunch outdoors.
author: Y A.

description:
These folks run a true gem in North Beach--it is intimate, festive, with excellent food both on and off the menu.  Ask what's good and let them guide you.  We had black linguini with seafood (yum) burrata that changed our life, and an excellent porchetta with fennel that melted right in our mouth.

Thank you Mario and Stephanie for a fabulous meal!  We'll be back!
author: Steven S.

description:
Authentic authentic authentic!  The food was incredible and the restaurant itself  reminded me of so many small trattorias in southern Italy.  The wait staff was pleasant and entertaining. We especially loved conversing with Mario (the owner) and our waiter in Italian, again felt like we were back in Calabria.  

I had the chicken with gnocchi in a Gorgonzola cream sauce...amazing!  Surprisingly not too rich but full of flavor. My mom and cousin had the special, sole with a caponata sauce....incredible. Light and flavorful would come back over and over for this dish!  The pasta al forno, which we ordered for my 6 yr old, was our least favorite. The penne were slightly over cooked and a bit dry.  

The portions are just right, food was served piping hot. the atmosphere is casual and a bit chaotic at least upstairs. It is a very tiny place, my daughter said "it's like we are in a doll house mamma". As long as you don't mind hearing your neighbors conversation, possibly even rubbing elbows with them and enjoy authentic Italian food this is a must try!

I'll be sure to visit every time I'm in San Francisco!
author: Tania S.

description:
I really wanted to try the seafood linguine so I was a bit saddened when I didn't see it on the menu. I asked instead for the seafood risotto, but the waiter then recommended a "seafood linguine with black sauce"... so just a tip: they make it even if it's not rotated on the menu :D.

Seafood linguine was amazing. Usually you get only a bit of seafood and a huge portion of pasta - but this was almost a 1:1 ratio. Really generous on the seafood (which was fantastic). My husband had the ravioli and I liked it, but the seafood linguini was definitely the standout of the two. 

Oh and the BREAD and the sauce. You're hit instantly with the mouthwatering, pungent aroma of garlic when they bring out the sauce but it's addictive. We ended up drizzling it over the buffalo mozzarella that at we got (very light and fresh tasting). 

Sad that I didn't have enough room for the Tiramisu dessert, but... next time! 

Ambiance notes: Waiter (or owner?) was hilarious and so charismatic.
author: Sylvia L.

description: Ridiculous place!  So small, so loud, below average food taste. They use supermarket grade olive oil and parmesan cheese. I hardly ever write reviews but in this case I am compelled from a sense of justice against all the glowing reviews that are completely contrary to our personal experience and from the hope that the owners would strive to improve their business.
author: K J.

description:
The food is so good that it motivated me to post my first yelp review to share about it. 

I walk past this restaurant everyday and notice there are always diners inside. today the wait stuff saw me walking by and in true Italian fashion hailed me in. It was 6pm ( 45min before I wrote this review) so they were all perky and friendly. 
Only a few small tables inside, very cozy. Seats had crumbs on them and tables a bit sticky..
I decided to get a takeaway. Staff were attentive and kind. It was a nice atmosphere in a small space watching the Italian waiters communicate with the Spanish speaking helpers. Lotsa banter and smiles in loud voices. 
Biggest drawback for me is no wifi- no one knew the password. 
Back home when I opened the box I was surprised my pizza is rectangular. It's the fravecat.  First bite into it transports you back Italy - very authentic flavors, fresh cheeses and rocca leaves. The crust was toasted perfect, not too hard on the outside.  Really yummy.
I notice tiramisu on the menu. I will go back for sure to try that soon.

*Didn't read previous reviews before trying, but I can understand why it is so highly rated.
author: Dr. Shannon B.

description:
My best friend and I were standing outside debating on where to eat when the owner came out and asked us how our night was then we proceeded to let him know that we were debating on what to eat. His charming personality and welcome ness was the reason we decided to eat here.
 Food was so delicious. They made us spaghetti and meatballs. The meatballs were juicy and tender with lots of flavor. ( not a fan of meatballs)The garlic olive oil with bread was top notch. I loved every garlic clove I ate.  
The whole environment was just great the waiters had a sense of humor along with charming personalities.  It felt as if you were at home eating dinner with your own family enjoying each others company.
author: Aimee P.

description: Mario and the crew are the best. Good wine, good food that doesn't break the bank. If you're a garlic lover like myself then I suggest trying the Spaghetti Aglio E Olio. The ribeye is legit on top of the arugula salad. The complimentary bread with the olive oil and garlic spread is delicious as well. Keep it up crew!
author: Ryan A.

description: I have insane respect for this place. I have had some great times here. The food is excellent. One of the few places around with a real brick oven. The pizzas pies are top notch. The inside is small, but very homely and nothing fancy, but just has a really cosy ambiance to it.   They also offer outside seating which is nice in the summer. It's an old place with lots of history. I love this place and look forward to my next visit there. Bravo!
author: Brandon M.

description:
Recommend!! 
I had a dish similar to baked ziti which was very good. I also had the arugula salad (delicious!!). Everything is clearly homemade. Service was great. The two men I dealt with were so nice and welcoming. 
The place is very small inside but don't let that turn you away! 
The only reason I did not give it 5 stars was just because I was never told the daily specials. After hearing the waiter tell them to someone else (after I placed my order unfortunately), I would have ordered something off that had I known the options so just be sure to ask what the specials are!
author: Jess J.

description: Small cozy restaurant with delicious pasta dishes, fresh ingredients and their linguini di mare is a must try. Friendly welcoming staff also
author: Roy O.

description:
My boyfriend and I dined here for the first time during the Chinese New Year parade. Despite the chaos of the festivities going on outside, the staff were professional, courteous, friendly, and attentive.

The food was absolutely divine. Fresh bread was served with an olive oil dipping sauce that was infused with chunks of garlic and chili pepper. We shared an order of fasul e' calamari, fresh calamari in a tasty broth with cannelloni beans, greens, and tomato. The caprese salad was fresh and delicious. My boyfriend enjoyed squid ink linguine with baby octopus while I had the risotto pescatore. Both dishes were absolutely smothered in seafood. They did not skimp. Every bite was filled with seafood deliciousness. We ended our meal with cannoli, espressos, and a couple shots of limoncello (I think it was limoncello, they just appeared at our table). Thanks, Mrs. Macaroni! ;-)

But I can't say enough good things about the service. Even though it was our first time dining here, we were immediately made to feel like we were part of the family.
